Although immediately rescued and removed to a hospital in Recife, the victim died from injuries suffered.

InitialEvent: Hull failure / failure of watertight doors / ports, etc.
SummaryOfEvents: During the afternoon of 22.09.2010 the research vessel Sea Profiler left Yarmouth for the Dogger Bank in the UK to position a wave buoy and to take scientific measurements in the area. On the 24 and 25 ofSept. 2010, there was a storm warning in effect. On the morning of24.09.2010 while the vessel was gathering scientific data the weather deteriorated with winds NNW force 6-7 and 2.5 mts waves. By nightfall there were winds force 8 and the waves increased. At 06:00LT on 25.09.2010 the engineers on watch detected two holes on the starboard side of the switchboard room between FR 41-42. The crew contained the ingress of water and the captain decided to head to Hul1. At 16:00LT the engineer on watch discovered water in the ER bilge coming from a broken pipe of the ballast water pump No. 1 (FR 20-21 starboard side). MRCC Humber was informed. At 17 :54L T a RAF helicopter delivered two portable pumps on board and attempts to evacuate part ofl the crew were made, but quickly aborted due to problems with a the generator of the helicopter. Ship operators arranged for the tugboat Red Wolfto meet the Sea Profiler at sea and to escort her to safety. At 24:00LT on 25.09.2010 the Red Wolf meets the Sea Profiler. At 21:00LT on 26.09.2010 the Sea Profiler was alongside Albert Docks. There were no injuries. The investigation conc1uded that the above-mentioned damages were caused by undetected wastage and corrosion. The ship had a history of repairs and corrosion due to its 55 years of service. The investigation also recommended the administration introduce more robust supervision of structural conditions on board research vessels older than 30 years.

Location: ALTURA ISLA FOCAS - LA ISLILLA - PAITA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 24 setiembre, siendo las 22:05 horas, el señor Julio RETO Montero, familiar del tripulante de la embarcación pesquera MARYORI sin matrícula, informó que a 20:30 horas citada embarcación sufrió siniestro marítimo (varadura), con SEIS (06) tripulantes a bordo, altura Isla Foca - La Islilla, durante retorno de faena de pesca, CINCO (05) tripulantes lograrón salir a la Isla Foca por sus propios medios, UN (01) tripulante se encuentra desaparecido. CAPIPITA, activó RCC, dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa SAN NICOLAS, embarcandose un enfermero a bordo, el dia 25 a 00:50 horas, la Patrullera de Costa efectuó el rescate de los CINCO (05) tripulantes y rescató el cuerpo sin vida del tripulante que se encontraba desaparecido, a 02:00 horas la Patrullera de Costa arribó al Puerto de Paita, con los tripulantes rescatados.

At 04:25 hrs on 23 September 2010, as  RMS Queen Mary 2 (QM2) was approaching Barcelona, an explosion occurred in the ship’s aft main switchboard room. Within a few seconds, all four propulsion motors shut down, and the ship blacked out shortly afterwards. Fortunately, the ship was clear of  navigational hazards and drifted in open sea.

The emergency generator started automatically and provided essential supplies to the ship, and it was quickly established that the explosion had taken place in the aft harmonic filter room, situated within the aft main switchboard was isolated, main generators were restarted and the ship was able to resume passage at 05:23 subsequently berthing in Barcelona at about 09:00 hrs. No one was injured.

After loading a cargo of 36,749 mt of Alumina in Vila do Conde, Brazil, MV Paros sailed late on 02 September 2010 bound for Karmoy, Norway.  The voyage was uneventful, with the vessel arriving in Karmoy on 19 September 2010.  Discharge of the cargo commenced later the same day.  A PSC inspection was carried out on board on 22 September 2010, with no major deficiencies reported.
At about 2335 on 22 September 2010, the duty oiler was in the engine control room, when he heard a noise resembling something falling inside the switchboard in way of No. 1 generator electrical panel fitted in the engine control room.
The noise was not investigated any further and the oiler was eventually requested to proceed to the engine-room to stop the water ballast pump and close all the valves.  Whilst attending the ballast pump, the fire alarm was activated.  The time was about 2345.  The oiler returned to the engine control room to observe dense smoke inside.  He used a portable CO2 extinguisher although he was unable to see the flames due to the dense smoke.
Following an analysis of the situation, it was concluded that the fire could not be controlled using local means and after following the necessary procedures, the fixed fire fighting installation was activated.  The local authorities were also informed but due to the dense smoke and heat, the fire fighters could not access the engine control room.  Eventually, two holes were cut in the upper deck above the engine control room and water pumped inside until the fire was suppressed and eventually extinguished at 0315.

At 10 :30 hrs on 22 September 2010, an ordinary seaman was found lifeless with severe head injuries on the port side catwalk after falling from the hatch coaming while the hatch cover on the MV Thule was being moved in the port of Naantali, Finland. The casualty died at the scene.
The hatch cover was to be raised with the shipboard crane while rape was being unloaded with a suction dredger. Here, one person was o the platform of the crane and the other was on the deck giving directions. The crew provided first aid and informed the emergency medical services.

SOLASStatus: AL HAKEEM: Unknown/unspecified, MAERSK WINDHOEK: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents: VESSEL "AL HAKEEM`S " STARBOARD BEAM COLLIDED ON SHIP`S BULBOUS BOW CAUSING HER TO BREAK INTO TWO AND SINK

Location: Caribbean Sea, 90 miles South of Santo Domingo
SummaryOfEvents: On 22 September 2010 the cargo ship OCEAN BLUE foundered in the Caribbean sea, 90 miles south of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.  All 7 crew members aboard the ship were rescued by ADRIAN and transferred to Dominican Navy ship ORION and taken to Santo Domingo.  There were no injuries reported.

On 21 September 2010 there was a serious accident  involving a hatch crane on board the Dutch mv Arklow Sky . At the time of the accident the ship was moored in the port of Bilbao, Spain. While closing the hold, after having unloaded the cargo, a hatch fell out of the hatch crane and into the hold. As a consequence of the impact of the falling hatch, the hatch crane came off its rails on the starboard side  and ended up partially in the ship's gangway . As a result the first mate, who was operating the hatch crane alone, fell from the operating platform on the hatch crane around eight metres down into the hold. He suffered serious injuries as a result of this fall and was admitted to hospital in a critical state. After around four weeks he awoke from a coma.
Consequences1: Serious injuries,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents:
At about 07:45 hrs on 21 September 2010, an accident occurred on the aft manoeuvring station while making fast the Cyprus registered hopper dredger Waterway in the Port of Emden.

The chief officer, who was operating the starboard hydraulic winch and had switched it to hauling, was caught by the line being wound onto the drum while attempting to clear it at the same time with his right foot. He let go of the spring-loaded operating lever of the winch, which then clicked back to the neutral position properly. Due to the winch’s technically induced stop delay, it did not stop immediately after the operating lever was released, but as subsequent tests concluded, only about 3.5 seconds later because of its design. This time delay resulted in the officer being dragged onto the winch by the line. In the process, he suffered a femoral neck fracture and other non-life threatening injuries.

Location: FRENTE A LA CALETA LOMAS - MOLLENDO
SummaryOfEvents:
Día 17 setiembre, siendo las 11:24 horas, la señora Kelly Quispe Ramos, informó que su embarcación pesquera DOÑA ALEJA de matrícula MO-21501-BM, no arribó en la fecha prevista,
CAPIMOLE activó RCC., emitió Aviso de Capitanía, el día 20 setiembre, siendo las 11:41 horas se efectuó comunicación con BIC MIGUEL OLIVER fin apoye con acciones de búsqueda en su zona de operaciones, siendo las 20:28 horas del mismo día, la referida nave, ubicó a la embarcación pesquera DOÑA ALEJA, con TRES (03) tripulantes a bordo, procediendo a remolcarla a la Caleta Lomas.

The bulk carrier "HS PIONEER" sustained mechanical problems at Batam, Indonesia circa 11/01/2010. It was subsequently sold for demolition and arrived at Jiangyn, China on 17/09/2010 for breaking up.
The tug "ROTTERDAM" proceeded to assist and effected tow to Yantai, China for cargo discharge, tow subsequently transferred to tug "DE XIANG" and arrived at Dalian Ocean Shipyard, Dalian, China on 15/04/2010 for inspection. It was reported beyond economical repair

At about 0805 LT on 16 September 2010, one ordinary seaman (Y) of the Hong Kong registered log and bulk carrier "Strait Challenger" slipped and fell from the log cargoes into the water while he was carrying out lashing works over the logs loaded at the after part of No. 1 Hatch portside.

He hit the ship's bulwark as he slipped and fell into the water.  At the time of the incident, another ordinary seaman (D) working in the vicinity jumped into the water trying to catch him but in vain.  D came back to the vessel after 5 minutes and said that he found some blood in the water.

At 0835 LT, the starboard lifeboat was lowered down into the water for search operation.

At 0852 LT, a fishing boat was called to assist the search operation and the incident was informed to the ship's management company and the local agent for assistance.

At 0917 LT, distress message was sent to Rescue Co-ordination Centre (RCC) via the land earth station "Yamaguchi".  At 0931 LT, Japan Coast Guard acknowledged receipt of the distress message, and the Master sent email to request the Japan Coast Guard to transfer the distress message to the RCC.

At 1020 LT, local (Malaysian) maritime and sea police rescue boat arrived scene and carried out search operation.

At 1140 LT, local (Malaysian) Coast Guard rescue boat arrived scene and assisted search operation.

At 1330 LT, diver boat arrived scene and assisted search operation.

At 1600 LT on 18 September 2010, despite search operation being carried out by Malaysian Maritime and Sea Police, Coast Guard and diver boat, there was no sign of the missing seaman.  The Master of Strait Challenger informed the ship management company, the local agent and the Malaysian Port Authority of the situation, obtained their permissions and departed Miri Anchorage for Kandla, India.

Silver Sturgeon was outbound on the River Thames by Woolwich Reach when the vessel lost power and the two thrustmaster propulsion units failed.  The master reported the incident to the local VTS using VHF.  A nearby tug offered assistance and subsequently stood by.  When power was lost the fire detection sytem activated simultaneously.  The master saw smoke escaping from the engine room vents and realised that there was a fire in the engine room.  Using the forward bow thrust for steering he continued to manoeuvre the vessel and requested that VTS arrange for a fire boat to attend.  The crew were fully mustered and the master ordered engine room vents to be shut and CO2 to be injected into the space.  The engine driving the bow thruster shut itself down and the tug standing by helped Silver Sturgeon to berth.  About 20 minutes later when the fire brigade arrived it was confirmed that the fire was extinguished.

ShipsInvolved: AL MAHMOUD TRANSPORTER (IMO 8701387), ALMHMOUD TRANSPORTER (IMO 8701387), LOUIS GAETANE 2 (-)
SOLASStatus: AL MAHMOUD TRANSPORTER: Unknown/unspecified, ALMHMOUD TRANSPORTER: SOLAS, LOUIS GAETANE 2: Unknown/unspecified
SummaryOfEvents:
Le 14 Septembre 2010 à 6 :42 hrs, le cargo panaméen AL Mahmoud Transporteur, faisant route Nord/Nord-ouest vers la marque de pilote du port de Sète, et le chalutier sétois Louis Gaetane 2, en action de pêche cap au Sud-ouest, entrent violemment en collision à la position 43°21’44 Nord, 003°48’03 Est.

La partie haute de l’étrave et le pavois bâbord  de la plage avant du chalutier en bois sont enfoncés par le choc tandis que le cargo n’a subit que des éraflures sur la muraille tribord à partir du point d’impact.

Il n’y a pas de blessés, cependant l’équipage du chalutier, choqué par l’accident, est hospitalisé pour examens à l’arrivée du navire à quai.

Les deux navires accostent au port de Sète, le cargo pour charger du bétail à destination du Liban, le chalutier à son poste habituel avant d’être mis au sec pour inspection de la coque.

Location: In the lake Washington ship Canal
SummaryOfEvents: The F/V ARTIC DOWN caught fire whilst moored South of the Ballard bridge in the lake Washington ship canal, Seattle, USA, on 12 September 2010. The blaze was brought under control with the assistance of over 100 firefighters. No injuries were reported. The vessel sustained severe damage to the superstructure.

On 11 September 2010, an 11 year old girl was killed when she fell from a banana boat ride.
The driver of the ski boat that was towing the banana boat was not aware that she had fallen in to the water, and did not see her as he continued on a tight circular route. The ski boat ran over the girl and its propeller caused severe injuries. She was pronounced dead soon after arriving at the hospital.

On Saturday 11 September 2010, at around 2:30 am, ib a clear night, the cargo ship Katharina, flying the Antigua and Barbuda flag collided against the trawler l’Aventure III, based in Dieppe, at a position located 18 miles in the North-north-east from Port-en-bessin.

Shortly before the collision, the cargo ship, coming from Nantes and bound to Caen, was heading South-east at 13.5 knots. The trawler was heading 080° at 9 knots to her fishing area located at 30 miles in the North-east from Port-en-Bessin. She was in a stand-on vessel position to the cargo ship.

Despite her last minute manoeuvre the trawler had been collided by the cargo ship on the port bow. No leak of pollution had been noticed

On 18 September 2010 at 16:00 hrs, the steamship Engelbrekt departed on a so called river trip from the jetty in Leksand. The route went south in the river Österdalälven and trough the lake Insjön. After passing the railway bridge in Insjön the plan was to continue south for a while before heading back to Leksand.

On board there were 49 passengers and ten crew members. All were members of the non progit organization which  took care and operated the steamship Engelbrekt.

The wheelhouse was manned by a helmsman and the master. The helmsman, who had long experience of Engelbrekt and the lake, was conning the ship. Next to him was the master who made his third trip. Normally, he was operating a taxi boat company in another lake and was working on Englebrekt when needed.

In the western part of Insjön there was a small islet called Getholmen which they had to pass before the railway bridge. The passage could be done either on the north or the south side. Going north of the Getholmen mean that the ship to make a sharp turn south after passing the islet. Close to the turn there was also a fish farm anchored, on the mainland side.

To indicate safe water there were two green spar buoys on the north side of Gethomen. Near the fishfarm there was also red spar buoy. In order to stay safe the south bound ship had to keep the green buoys on the port side and the red one on the starboard side. 

As the ship approached Getholmen the master and the helmsman noticed some orange colored jerricans in the water ahead of them. At first they thought that the jerricans was marking a fish net, something that was a common sight in the autumn. 

They only saw one of the two green spar buoys in the area. After checking the chart, the helmsman and master draw the conclusion that the jerricans was substituting the second green buoy. As the ship passed the jerricans the helmsman therefore put the rudder hard to port in order to turn south.  Shortly after, at approximately 17:00 hours, the ship went aground.

The crew conducted a damage control and arranged for a tug boat to assist. No persons were injured and no damage to the hull or water ingress was noticed.

At 18:31 hours an unknown person called the emergency number to SOS Alarm. The rescue services and police arrived at 19:00 hours. Breathalyzer tests were made on the master and the helmsman. Both test results were negative.

The rescue service assisted in the evacuation of all passengers after which the tugboat pulled the ship off the ground at 21:30 hours. Engelbrekt then steamed back to Leksand were they arrived at 22:15 hours.

On 10 September 2010, the ship SEVERN SANDS was stranded after breaking moorings in the Taw Estuary, off Chivenor UK.   The moorings parted at 1930 hrs on 9 September 2010, whilst the ship was moored at Fremington.  The ship drifted on the high tide prior to stranding on the opposite side of the estuary.  The ship had been laid up unmanned since March 2007.  On 11 September 2010, the tug LUNDY PUFFIN tried unsuccessfully to refloat the ship.  On 7 October 2010, at 1800 hrs, the ship refloated with the assistance of the carrier MANNING.  She was subsequently towed to Yelland where she was broken up by DRS Demolition.

On 9 September 2010 in typhoon Meranti, the cargo ship WINNER 12 was stranded whilst departing Kaohsiung, Taiwan, China.  The ship sustained damage to starboard lower hull and took water.  No injuries or pollution were reported.  On 10 September, the ship refloated with the assistance of 2 tugs and was towed to berth in harbour for pumping out and inspection.  On 18 September 2010 the ship arrived at Xinhui, China where is was broken up, having been reported as being damaged beyond economical repair.

PANAMA FLAG M/V "VOLCAN DE TAHICHE" tHAT THE BOSUN, MAURITANIAN NATIONAL ON BOARD VESSEL, FELL ON BALLAST TANK WHILE HE PREPARED SHIP MAINTENANCE AT PORT OF LAS PALMAS, SPAIN ON SEPTEMBER 8 OF CURRENT YEAR. tHE BOSUN DIES AFTER IN HOSPITAL.

Location: FRENTE A LA CALETA CASMA - CHIMBOTE
SummaryOfEvents: Día 07 setiembre, siendo las 16:00 horas el señor Carlos Silva Miranda, representante de la embarcación pesquera TEO matrícula CE-28410-CM, informó que su embarcación sufrió hundimiento a 14:30 horas, en la posición Latitud 09° 27' Sur y Longitud 078° 25' Oeste, en circunstancias en que se encontraba retornando al puerto de Chimbote con pesca en sus bodegas, los OCHO (08) tripulantes de la referida embarcación fueron rescatados por la embarcación pesquera JOSELITO-2 de matrícula PL-22853-CM.

Día 07 setiembre, siendo las 10:40 horas, el señor Felix Chapilliquen Ruiz, informó que la embarcación pesquera ROSITA 4, zarpó el día 01 setiembre con SEIS (06) tripulantes a bordo, no habiendo arribado en la fecha prevista. CAPIPITA activó RCC, emitió Aviso de Capitanía correspondiente, el día 08 setiembre, el propietario de la referida embarcación informó a las 05:30 horas arribó su embarcación por sus propios medios al Puerto de Talara.

Día 07 setiembre, siendo las 08:48 horas en el Sistema COSPAS SARSAT se recepcionó la activación de la radiobaliza de la embarcación pesquera LUZ MARIA-I, CAPILO activó RCC, el propietario informó que su embarcación se encuentra al garete fallas mecánicas, se dispuso el zarpe de la embarcación pesquera GAMALU-II de matrícula IO-22402-BM, con personal Guardacostas a bordo, el día 08 setiembre, siendo las 04:42 horas se ubicó a la referida embarcación, efectuando el remolque hacia el Puerto de Ilo.

The fisher went fishing in the early hours of 7 September 2010 in a small open boat at Cullenstown, Co. Wexford. He failed to return home. His boat was found upturned and his remains were recovered later on the same day.

Día 06 setiembre, siendo las 20:15 horas, se tomó conocimiento que la embarcación pesquera MILAGRITOS DE JESUS matrícula CO-29883-BM, con SIETE (07) tripulantes a bordo se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas, CAPICALA activó RCC, el día 07 setiembre, siendo las 15:08 horas en la posición Latitud 11º 48.2 S y Longitud 077º 15.9 Oeste, la referida embarcación fue rescatada por la Patrullera Marítima RIO OCOÑA, procediendo luego a remolcarla hacia el Puerto del Callao.

On September 3, 2010 at approximately 0910LT, the TENYO  was in a collision with the  F ELEPHANT  during the TENYO’s bunkering operations. The F ELEPHANT was proceeding into AEBA Sector G at the Port of Singapore; the vessel turned westbound against a southeasterly current. Despite attempting to move the F ELEPHANT astern, the vessel contacted the anchored TENYO on her port bow. The TENYO sustained damage to the shell plating and a tear in the hull; there were no injuries to the crew reported. As a result of the collision, the bunker barge hose parted and leaked a small amount of oil in the water (approximately 100 liters) and on the deck of the bunker barge (approximately 800 liters). The TENYO was inspected by the vessel’s class and determined fit to proceed to another anchorage location for repairs.

On September 3, 2010 at approximately 0910LT, the  F ELEPHANT  was involved in a collision with the  TENYO. The F ELEPHANT was proceeding into AEBA Sector G at the Port of Singapore; the vessel turned westbound against a southeasterly current. Despite attempting to move the F ELEPHANT astern, the vessel contacted the anchored TENYO on her port bow. The F ELEPHANT sustained indentation on the forecastle railings and bend in the starboard anchor; there were no injuries to the crew or pollution reported.

Día 02 setiembre siendo las 14:45 horas, el señor Juan ALVAREZ Panta, propietario de la embarcación pesquera MANUELITO, informó que su embarcación se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas (Bomba de Inyección petróleo) frente a la Caleta Lobitos, con CINCO (05) tripulantes abordo. CAPILARA, activó RCC. a 15:00 horas dispuso zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa CHORRILLOS fin efectuar búsqueda y rescate, a 17:20 horas se ubicó a la embarcación pesquera MANUELITO, procediendo a remolcarla hacia fondeadero desembarcadero Pesquero Artesanal Lobitos, por presencia de fuertes vientos en la zona.

Location: A 145 MILLAS A LA CUADRA DE PAITA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 04 setiembre, siendo las 09:25 horas, el señor Pablo Azalde, patrón de la embarcación pesquera JESUS MI BUEN PASTOR-2, informó que el día 01 setiembre siendo las 19:00 horas en zona de pesca Latitud 05º 07’ S y Longitud 082º 23’ W, sufrieron caida al mar de los tripulantes Jhonatan RAMIREZ Alayo (24) y Jorge Luís JUAREZ Juarez (28), y que efectuó la búsqueda en la zona contando con el apoyo de otras embarcaciones hasta el día 03 setiembre, con resultados negativos. CAPIPITA, activó RCC, emitió aviso de capitanía alertando a los pescadores y embarcaciones que operan en la zona, desde el día 05 al 20 setiembre, con apoyo de embarcaciones que operan en la zona, se efectuó la búsqueda con resultados negativos, a la fecha los dos tripulantes se encuentran en la condicion de desaparecidos en la mar.

The general cargo ship "MEDY" took water, developed list to port and sank in the Black sea, 10 miles Southeast of Constanta, Romania at 1251 hours on 01/09/2010 in heavy weather. All 17 crew members were rescued by ORSV "GSP ORION" and taken to Constanta. No injuries were reported. 150 square foot oil slick was reported in sea. Anti-pollution vessels "RUBIN" and "SAFIR" and tug "HERCULES" assisted with the clean up operation.

Location: 60 miles at east-south open sea from sandong penisular, china
SummaryOfEvents:
Chmical tanker OCEAN ACE NO.3 collided with unnamed chinese fishing vessel.
Then chinese fishing vessel sunk and fisher mans not identified died.

After she had discharged her load of crude oil, FLANDRE sailed from the port of Ningbo on 31 August 2010, bound to Fujairah (United Arab Emirates).
She took the long fairway connecting the port to the high sea, in the middle of a large number of islands and with a busy traffic. The pilot was on board and the captain was on the bridge.
At 10:57 hours am, after FLANDRE had rounded one of these islands, the radar echo of Hua.Chi.8, a landing craft type coaster, appeared on her radar display, at less than 2 miles
(about 1,7 mile), 2 points on the starboard side, crossing.
Despite last minute manoeuvres FLANDRE collided with the coaster on her port stern at 11.01 hours am.
The latter capsized immediately and sank soon after with 6 out of the 7 crew members. There was only one survivor.
FLANDRE had a breach in her bulb afore the collision bulkhead under the water line.
There was no pollution.
The pilot sent FLANDRE to anchorage, leaving her at the Chinese MSA disposal.

Location: Outside the Port of Santo Tomas De Castilla
SummaryOfEvents: At approximately 12.44 on 3rd August 2010 the bulk carrier CLIPPER TOBAGO reduced speed as she arrived at the pilot station, and the Master and the Chief Engineer performed a main engine test using emergency controls in the Engine Room. The test was successful, and the Master then took over command of the bridge. It was agreed that the meeting point for the pilot and the vessel would be between bouys 3 and 4, and the Master received a request from the pilot station to increase speed to accommodate outgoing traffic. Whilst closely observing the echo sounder, the Master noticed the depth decreasing rapidly. The heading was 170 and the approximate speed was 12.6 knots. A few seconds later the vessel went aground.
Cargo1: Tallow Grease, Yellow Grease, LAB and Poultry Grease

SummaryOfEvents: Norman Arrow was approaching her berth, sternfirst, when she was set down by the effects of a beam wind made contact with a mooring dolphin which the bridge team had not seen, due to the limited visibility from the manoeuvring station. The vessel's hull was holed in way of the port side forward engine room, which was flooded to sea level. The vessel  manoeuvred off the dolphin and then took a tug before berthing without futher mishap. The vessel was taken out of service as a result of the damage.

On 27 August 2010 at approximately 18:32 Mountain Daylight Time, the passenger ship Clipper Adventurer ran aground in coronation Gulf, Nuvatut while on a 14-day Artic cruise. On 29 August, all 128 passengers were transferred to the CCGS Amundsen and taken to Kugluktuk, Nuvatut.
The clipper Adventurer was refloated on 14 September 2010 and escorted to Port Epworth, Nuvatut. There was minor pollution and no injuries

At approximately 06.15 hours on 27th August 2010 the container ship HUB KUCHING suffered an engine room fire whilst en route from Bangkok to Port Klang. 
The fire was caused by leaking of a high pressure fuel line on one of the generators. 

Initial attempts were made to put out the fire by portable extinguishers and a fire hose, but these failed due to very rapid spread of the fire. A fixed fire system was then used, but this also failed. 

At about 07.30 hours, the Master decided that the fire was out of control and gave orders to abandon ship. All the crew were rescued by the vessel M/V Goliath Leader, which was passing by.The fire was put out and stabilized by the salvage tug engaged by the ship owner.

The vessel was later towed to safety and reached Pasir Gudang, Malaysia on 5th September 2010 for repairs. There was no loss of life or pollution due to the incident. The engine room and accomodation completely burnt out.

Le 25 août 2010 après-midi, le navire du patrimoine (statut de voilier à utilisation
collective) NOTRE DAME DE RUMENGOL, à gréement « dundee », immatriculé BR 267500, effectue une navigation commerciale sous voiles en rade de Brest, avec 20 passagers, par vent assez fort de Sud/Sud-Ouest.
Après avoir effectué un virement de bord « lof pour lof » (vent arrière), l’extrémité du mât arrière (mât d’artimon ou de « dundee ») se brise en entraînant la chute du gréement sur tribord.
L’espar supérieur (appelé pic ou corne) tombe sur la jambe gauche d’une passagère située sur le passavant tribord. Grièvement blessée, celle-ci est évacuée par hélicoptère.

Location: Hong Kong, China / Northwest Lamma Anchorage
InitialEvent: Relieving Chief Engineer Fallen from Pilot Ladder and Drowned
SummaryOfEvents: At about 1905 on 24 August 2011, the Hong Kong, China registered bulk carrier Apollo was at anchor in Hong Kong, china.  The relieving Chief Engineer (C/E), who just arrived at the ship’s side after a journey of about 14 hours from Sri Lanka, fell into the water when he was climbing the pilot ladder to board the vessel.  He was retrieved from the water to the service launch by the joint effort of the launch attendant and the ship’s crew in about 10 minutes.  Despite first aid treatment and cardiopulmonary resuscitation applied to him on the launch as well as emergency treatment in the hospital, he was certified dead at 2105 the same day.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship remains fit to proceed

Location: FRENTE A LA CALETA LA CRUZ - ZORRITOS
SummaryOfEvents: Día 23 agosto, siendo 08:20 horas el señor Danny SILVA Mogollón, propietario de la embarcación pesquera DAVID, informó que su embarcación zarpó el día 19 agosto a la zona de pesca frente a la Caleta Negritos, con SEIS (06) tripulantes a bordo y que no ha arribado en la fecha prevista. CAPILARA, activó RCC, emitió Aviso de Capitanía, dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera Marítima RIO OCOÑA, que efectuó búsqueda con resultados negativos, el día 24 agosto la tripulación de la embarcación pesquera NICOL, informaron que se encontraban remolcando a la embarcación pesquera DAVID, por lo que se dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa PACASMAYO, ubicando a la citada embarcación en la posición Latitud 03° 29´S y Longitud 080° 45’ W,  la tripulación manifestó que se quedaron al garete por fallas mecánicas, siendo remolcados hacia la Caleta La Cruz, donde arribaron a 18:15 horas.

Le dimanche 21 août 2010, le chalutier JERICHO appareille du Havre en fin de
journée, avec trois hommes à bord, pour pêcher dans le Nord du Cap de La Hève, à moins de 2 milles de la côte. Au 3ème trait de chalut, le patron constate que la  température d’échappement s’accroît et que la vitesse du navire diminue. Pensant qu’il a pêché un débris quelconque, il vire son chalut et décide de déposer le poids parasite en dehors des zones de pêche, sur une épave située plus au Sud.
Alors qu’il est à moins d’un mille de l’épave, la pluie commence à tomber et les deux matelots entreprennent de capeler leurs cirés. C’est à ce moment qu’une pièce de remontée du chalut casse ; le patron n’a que le temps de stopper et de débrayer le moteur, mais le JERICHO chavire brutalement sur tribord. Les matelots tombent à la mer et le patron s’extirpe de la timonerie. Peu après, le JERICHO flotte à l’envers sans que le radeau de survie ne puisse se déclencher. Les trois marins se perdent rapidement de vue après que le patron ait crié aux matelots de s’écarter de la coque.
La balise 406 MHz se déclenche à 22h29, soit environ une heure après le chavirement ; des moyens sont mis en oeuvre par le CROSS Jobourg à partir de 22h47, bien que la position soit incertaine. Le patron sera récupéré en état de choc par un navire de pêche et un matelot parviendra à atteindre le rivage, mais le corps sans vie du second matelot sera retrouvé à plusieurs milles du lieu du naufrage.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: Día 19 agosto 2010 a 19:00 horas, por braveza del mar se rompió el fondo del Artefacto Naval HUARMEY, con NUEVE (09) tripulantes abordo, el día 20 agosto a 01:55 horas, con apoyo del personal del Grupo de Salvamento de la Marina de Guerra, a bordo del Remolcador Marítimo DANIEL, se efectuó el rescate de los tripulantes, siendo traslados hacia el Puerto Callao.

Día 19 agosto 2010, a 17:30 horas aproximadamente, por braveza del mar el bote de goma Zodiac sufrió siniestro marítimo (volcadura), con DOS (02) tripulantes abordo, de los cuales el señor Hugo Winston PULCE Mosqueda, desapareció en la mar, CAPICHAN activó RCC, dispuso patrullaje vía terrestre por proximidades playa Chorrillos con resultados negativos. 
Día 20 agosto 2010, se continuó búsqueda con apoyo de familiares, pescadores de la zona, resultados negativos, el día 21 agosto 2010 a 11:30 horas aproximadamente, se encontró cuerpo sin vida del citado tripulante en inmediaciones de playa La Viña.

Location: A 03 MILLAS AL NORTE DE LA CALETA COLAN - PAITA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 18 agosto, siendo las 20:35 horas la Estación Costera Paita recepcionó llamada radial del Capitán del Remolcador Marítimo TRAMARSA 3, informando haber sufrido varadura en la posición Latitud 04° 53’S y Longitud 081° 09’W aproximadamente a 3 millas de costa al norte de la caleta Colán, con SEIS (06) tripulantes y DOS (02) pasajeros a bordo. CAPIPITA, activó RCC, a 21:15 horas dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa SAN NICOLAS, el día 19 agosto siendo las 09:50 horas se efectuó el rescate de los tripulantes y pasajeros en buen estado de salud, siendo trasladados al Puerto de Paita.

InitialEvent: Fatal accident of a stevedore during discharging operation
SummaryOfEvents: At about 1832 hours (JST: UTC + 9 hours), August 18, 2010 during discharging operation, an unconscious stevedore was found on the starboard side of the main deck near No.4 cargo hold. He was confirmed dead after being taken to a hospital. The cause of the death was lung contusion.

The 65-GT passenger ship Djurgården 4 was used for hop-on hop-off sightseeing cruises in the Stockholm area. The cruises, with a number of intermediate stops, started and ended at Nybrokajen located at the end of Nybroviken, a small bay between Östermalm and Blasieholmen. At every stop the ship went with the bow in towards the jetty and was kept in position by the propulsion.
On 18 August at 16.30 hrs at Nybrokajen the master and the deckhand relieved the regular crew on board Djurgården 4 for dinner break. After a verbal handover the ship departed on the one-hour cruise.
After departure from the jetty at the Vasa museum there were 75 passengers on board and the master set the course back to Nybrokajen, a distance of approximately 0.5 nautical miles. In Nybroviken there were several other passenger ships berthed along the quay sides. As Djurgården 4 was in line with the ships on the northern side of the bay the master put the gear in neutral to slow down. At this time the deck hand was standing at the forward gate. The passengers were getting ready for arrival and many of them were standing on the forward area of the ship.
At a distance of 50-60 meters from the jetty the master put the gear in reverse in order to stop the ship at the berth. He soon realized that there was no response on the manoeuvre and the ship continued towards the jetty. In an attempt to get reverse power, the master put the throttle handle to maximum for a short moment. But, instead of slowing down, the speed increased so he immediately put the handle in neutral again. The distance to the jetty was 30-40 meters when the master grabbed the microphone to the public address system and informed the people on board to hold on. He also initiated a portside turn to avoid hitting the jetty.
At 17:25 hours Djurgården 4 ran into the jetty at Nybrokajen at a speed of approximately 5-7 knots. The deckhand jumped over the forward railing just as the ship hit the jetty. He landed ashore, immediately called the emergency number 112 and then assisted in mooring the ship. On board Djurgården 4 the situation got chaotic when the passengers could not open the forward gate to disembark the ship. The crew members quickly opened the gate and evacuated the passengers.
In total 24 persons were injured of which eleven were taken to hospital for check up. All, except one person with a fractured collarbone, could leave the hospital the same day. The ship sustained damage to the hull and the superstructure.
During the testing of the repaired part of an elbow on a ballast line, the elbow failed from the joints, hitting one crew member and causing fatal injuries.

Día 18 agosto, siendo las 15:00 horas el señor Edgar POZO, representante de la embarcación pesquera MANTARO, informó haber recibido llamada telefónica del Patrón de su embarcación, quien le informó que se encontraban al garete por fallas mecánicas frente a la Punta Capullanas, con TRES (03) tripulantes a bordo, CAPILARA, activó RCC, a 15:30 horas dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa CHORRILLOS en demanda a la citada área, a 16:05 horas la Patrullera de Costa ubicó a la mencionada embarcación en la posición Lat. 04°29´S y Long. 081°18´W a 17:30 horas arribó la Patrullera de Costa remolcando a la citada embarcación pesquera.

Location: Pacific Ocean, approx 800 km SE of Dunedin, New Zealand
SummaryOfEvents: On 18 August 2010 at 0437 hrs, while recovering nets, the stern trawler O YANG No. 70, listed, took water in the processing hold and sank in the Pacific Ocean, approximately 800 km SE of Dunedin, New Zealand.  Three crew members were reported dead and 3 were missing.  Forty-five crew members abandoned the ship in liferafts, were later rescued by AMALTAL ATLANTIS and taken to Christchurch, New Zealand.  Seven ships and an RNZAF P-3 aircraft assisted with the SAR operation.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents:
On voyage from Mumbai in India to Fujairah in the United Arabic Emirates (U.A.E). One of the ship’s able bodied (AB) seaman died due to illness.

Malaria test conducted as part of the on-board treatment proved positive.

On 16 August 2011, four persons were on a fishing trip off Castletownbere, West Cork, Ireland, when the craft suddenly experienced uncontrollable flooding. This was followed shortly thereafter by an electrical fire which originated in an electrical cabinet. Efforts to extinguish the fire were unsuccessful and as such all four persons on board  had to abandon the craft. Three persons subsequently drowned.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: On 15 August 2010, under heavy weather conditions, the cargo ship NAND APARAJITA dragged its anchor and became stranded on a coral reef off Kavaratti Island, Lakshadweep, India.  No injuries or pollution were reported and all 15 crew members were rescued.  The ship sustained damage to the hull and took in water in the engine room.  An initial salvage operation was unsuccessful due to the strong winds.  Cargo and 18.5 tonnes of bunker fuel were subsequently removed by salvors.  The ship was later broken up.

SOLASStatus: HANJIN SALERNO: Unknown/unspecified, SEVEN SEAS: Unknown/unspecified
SummaryOfEvents: On 12 August 2010, at 2200 hrs, the tanker SEVEN SEAS collided with ship HANJIN SALERNO whilst anchored at Tema, Ghana.  The tanker was towed to shore by tug, having sustained damage to its hull and took water in the engine room. She was intentionally grounded to prevent sinking.  No injuries or pollution were reported.  All 3 crew members were rescued.  The tanker had been laid up at anchorage with a minimum crew and no lights.  On 14 August 2010, at 1900 hrs, the tanker exploded and caught fire when looters attempted to siphon off fuel from the wreckage.  Four persons were killed, 70 were injured and the tanker was completely burnt out.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

Location: 26 nautical miles off Cape Recife, South Africa
SummaryOfEvents: The stern trawler "MARIE CLAIRE" caught fire and sank 26 nautical miles off Cape Recife, South Africa at 1932 hours on 10/08/2010. All 40 crew members were rescued by F/V "TOROLLA" and "MAVERICK" and taken to port Elizabeth, South Africa. No injuries were reported. The wreck last sighted was drifting semi submerged on 12/08/2010.

Location: close to the pilot point of Mumbai (PORT)
SummaryOfEvents:
On 7th August 2010, MV MSC Chitra (a Panama flag container vessel), IMO no. 7814838 outbound from Jawaharlal Nehru Port (JNP) whilst transiting through a common channel of Mumbai (Bombay) Port (MbP), collided with MV Khalijia-3 (a St. Kitts and Nevis flag bulk carrier), IMO no. 8128690,  inbound for  MbP. This lead to the container vessel ‘MSC Chitra’ developing a heavy list to port due damages to her under water hull and ingress of water eventually resulting in her running aground off the Prongs Reef lighthouse within the Mumbai Port limits, loss of containers into the water and pollution due to rupture of fuel oil tanks. The bulk carrier ‘Khalijia-3’ also suffered structural damages on her stem and forward tanks. 
There was no loss of life or injury to personnel, however, the collision caused substantial damage to the environment due to pollution and resulted in closure of both the ports (MbP and JNP) for a few days followed by restricted port operations for many days due to containers falling off MSC Chitra into the channel and many strayed floating

MSC Chitra was outbound 1219 containers from JawaharLal Nehru Port on 07/08/10. MV Khalijia-3 was inbound with 30924 MT of steel coils from Mumbai port inner anchorage to berth. There was no pilot on both vessels. The two vessels collided in the port channel. Subsequent to the collision, MSC Chitra veeered off towards inner anchorages and agrounded in shallow waters. Thereafter MSC Chitra developed list of about 75 deg to port and substantial number of containers were lost overboard. The collision resulted in breach of hull of MSC Chitra thereby causing escape of about 1200 MT of fuel oil. MV Khalijia -3 suffered heavy damage to the fore part of the vessel and was towed into Mumbai port for repairs. MSC Chitra, subsequently was refloated by salvage company and towed outside the Indian EEZ. MSC Chitra was a total loss.

Location: Sibuyan Sea, 5 miles NE off the Dos Hermanas Islands, Philippines
SummaryOfEvents: On 7 August 2010, at 0220 hrs, under tropical storm Ester, the cargo ship SF FREIGHTER sustained engine failure and sank in the Sibuyan Sea, 5 miles NW off the Dos Hermanas Islands, Marinduque, Philippines.  All crew members abandoned ship; 3 members were rescued, 6 died and 8 were reported missing.  Coastguard ships, aircraft, ships, carriers SEA FORD and SF MARNIER, and tug DON PILO assisted in the SAR operation.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: The Mixed Cargo – Bulk Liquids and General Cargo vessel “Praia do Sancho”, ex-fishing boat “Epsilon”, No. IMO  XXX,  flagged Brazil, Port of Registry Recife, 79.125 DWT, returned from Fernando de Noronha to the port of Recife where she was berthed at the quay of warehouse 14, giving start to a period of maintenance. Amongst the services programmed were maintenance of the generator onboard, installation of triphasic electric switchboard in substitution of the single-phase, cleaning of the tanks that had carried gasoline. On 6th August, commenced the draining of gasoline residues from tank 06 (STBD) and 05 (PORT) using a portable elctrical pump existing onboard. Approximately at 08h30min, occurs the explosion in the empty hold and in the engine room ( adjoining areas). The accident resulted in two (2) fatal victims and two (2) wounded.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

Location: Complexo Portuario de Vitória, Espírito santo
SummaryOfEvents: While performing work aboard the Brazilian flagged General Cargo Ship Arlott, IMO number 9065895, Call Sign	PP8341, MMSI 710004220, Gross tonnage 7662, DWT 9488 T, built 1994, a crew member fell, and later died from his injuries. The accident is under investigation and no other details were obtained up to this time.  Further details will be issued when available. No pollution (no oil spill ) were observed.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship remains fit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents:
At 19:46 hours on 5 August 2010, the Italian registered ro-ro passenger ferry Scottish Viking was in collision with the UK registered fishing vessel Homeland about 4 miles off St Abb’s Head. As a result of the collision the fishing vessel sank.
The skipper was recovered from the sea but, despite an extensive search by the rescue services and a large number of local fishing vessels, the remaining crew member, was lost.

Location: 15 miles SE of Bulukumba, South Sulawesi, Indonesia
SummaryOfEvents: On 4 August 2010, at 0235 hrs, in poor visibility, the cargo ship, TRISAL PRATAMA sank after a collision with ship INDIMATAM, 15 miles SE of Bulukumba, South Sulawesi, Indonesia.  Search and Rescue teams attended the scene: Seven persons were rescued by ship KENCANA V; 2 by ship LET KHRISNAN; and 2 by ship TILONG KABILA.  All survivors were transferred to ship TILONG KABILA and taken to Makassar, Indonesia.  Several persons sustained minor injuries.  Twelve persons were reported missing.

Location: Empresa Brasileira de Reparos Navais S.A
SummaryOfEvents:
The bulk carrier AUK ARROW (IMO 8309397, dwt 43952, built 1984, flag Bahamas), was moored at a shipyard in Rio de Janeiro on 2nd August 20010 when one of the ballast tanks exploded, at approximately 22.00 hours. One person was found dead by rescue teams on site, while another was later pronounced dead at the hospital. A further five people were injured. The workers were all Brazilian, employed by the shipyard. 
None of the 31 Indian crew members on board the vessel were injured. The accident is under investigation. 
No other details have been obtained up to this time. No pollution (no oil spill ) observed. 
Further details will be issued when available.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Serious injuries,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

SOLASStatus: ALPHA PRESTIGE: SOLAS, FPMC CONTAINER 7: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents: On August 1, 2010 at approximately 0140LT, the Liberian Flag container vessel, FPMC CONTAINER 7  was involved in a collision while berthed at the Haiphong, Vietnam . The Panamanian products tanker, ALPHA PRESTIGE, was coming into berth and collided with the FPMC CONTAINER 7. As a result, the FPMC CONTAINER 7 sustained damage to the starboard and port side shell plating and ballast tank number four.
At 0150 hours while rigging the pilot combination ladder on starboard side, boatswain fall overboard washed by a wave from the combination ladder platform.

Location: Quarry Rapids, Red River, North of Winnepeg, Manitoba
SummaryOfEvents: On 29 July 2010, at approximately 10:30 hrs, Central day time, the passenger ship River Rouge with 71 passengers and crew on board ran aground in the Quarry Rapids on the Red River, north of Winnipeg, Manitoba. Following an unsuccessful attempt to refloat the ship, all 63 passengers and 6 of the crew were evacuated by the Canadian Coast Guard. The ship was refloated 1 week later. There were no injuries, damage to the ship or pollution.

During the night, in good weather conditions, the F/V LAISSE D'IN DIRE was on the way with automatic pilot to her fishing area, 2 milles in the west of the Pointe de Chémoulin (Loire Atlantique). The navigation was followed with the electronic chart on a computer.
When the skipper took the watch after the seaman, the situation was clear.
Then the seaman left the bridge to prepare the fishing equipment on the deck and the skipper focused his attention to the fishing zone, with a zoom on the display, loosing like this information about the vessel's position.
A few minutes later, the vessel grounded violently on the rocks close to a small island.
The vessel rapidly capsized and the 8 kilometers of fishing net falled from the deck; the skipper didn't manage to extricate from it.
The seaman was rescued 45 minutes after the 406 Mhz beacon was detected.

Location: Pointe de Chemoulin, Estuaire de la Loire
SummaryOfEvents:
Dans la nuit du 28 au 29 juillet 2010, par beau temps, le fileyeur Laisse D’In Dire fait route sous pilote automatique vers sa zone de pêche, située dans le Sud-Ouest du banc de sable de Baguenaud, à environ 2 milles dans l'Ouest de la Pointe de Chémoulin. Le suivi de la navigation est effectué à l'aide d'une carte électronique, sur l'ordinateur de bord.
Lorsque le patron prend le quart à la suite du matelot, après un court repos, le Laisse D’In Dire navigue en eaux saines, un peu au large de la route tracée. Le matelot se rend alors sur le pont pour préparer le matériel de pêche, tandis que le patron vérifie sur l'ordinateur les points où seront calés les filets.
Peu après, le Laisse D’In Dire heurte violemment les roches situés à proximité de l'îlot de La Pierre Percée. Le matelot questionne brièvement le patron qui ne comprend pas ce qui est arrivé. Le navire est échoué et gîte sur tribord, les sabords de décharge ne parviennent pas à évacuer l'eau qui monte rapidement.
Le patron retourne en timonerie pour tenter d'alerter le CROSS Etel. A ce moment le navire chavire sur tribord et la lourde masse des filets bascule par le fond. Le matelot, un moment prisonnier sous la bâche d'abri, parvient à remonter en surface. Il nage jusqu'au rocher le plus proche et se tient prêt à porter secours au patron qu'il ne voit pas et dont il n'obtient pas de réponse, malgré ses appels répétés.
Le matelot sera récupéré peu après par le canot SNSM de Pornichet. Les investigations des plongeurs sont rendues difficiles par l'obscurité et l'obstruction provoquée par les filets. Après le lever du jour, le corps sans vie du patron est retrouvée à 10 mètres de l'épave.
L'épave sera renflouée le 8 août 2010 ; les appareils de navigation ont été détruits et emportés par la mer.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents: On 28 July 2010, the very large crude carrier M. STAR, carrying 270,000 tons of oil, en route to Japan's Chiba port was damaged by an explosion, in the Omani territorial waters nea,r the Strait of Hormuz, which passes Iran and Oman.  The explosion is feared to have been caused by a deliberate grenade attack .  One lifeboat was blown off the ship and a large dent was made in its hull.  Of the 31 crew members aboard; 1 crew member was slightly injured.  There were no reports of any oil leaks.

Location: 6 miles SE of Ostrov Korga, Russia
SummaryOfEvents: On 26 July 2010, at 1900 hrs, the cargo ship VARNEK capsized and was found stranded 6 miles SE of Ostrov Korga, Kanin Peninsula, Russia.  The last contact made with the ship was at 2020 hrs on 23 July 2010 under heavy weather conditions (latitude 68 31N and longitude 43 05E).  Reports indicate, 5 crew members and 3 passengers are missing and 1 passenger reported dead.  The search and rescue operations using helicopters and aircraft commenced on 26 July 2010.  From the assistance of Tugs BOREY and AGAT, the ship was refloated, however subsequently sank whilst under tow to Arkhangelsk, Russia on 5 August 2010 at 0545 hrs.

1.	DURING THE PREPARING PILOT LADDER ON PORT SIDE, SUDDELY COMING TO HIGH SWELL AND CARRIING OUT HIM.
2.	IMMEDIATELY THREW LIFE BUOY WITH LIFE LINE AT HIM BY BSN- BORROMEO WILSON PAULINO, OS- AGUMO-O MARK JEFFREY PATRIMONIO & OS- BELGIRA SUNNY PAUL REPALBOR. THAT TIME DUTY OFFICER 3/O- ARIAS ARVIN MUNOZ REPORTED MASTER.
3.	MASTER IMMEDIATELY SOUNDED MANOVERBOARD ALARM MAY DAY SIGNAL BY VHF AND CALLING ALL HANDS ON DECK, FOR RESCUED HIM
4.	MASTER REPORTED TO GOA PORT CONTROL, AGENT & SHIP`S OWNER AT ABOUT 0907HRS ON 26TH JULY 2010 AND EMERGENCY REQUIRED SERCH & RESCUE TEAM
5.	0945LT  26TH JULY, COMMENCED RESCUE BY SHORE (HELICOPTER / RESCUE BOAT)

Location: 25 miles W-SW of Hoek Van Holland
SummaryOfEvents: The general cargo ship "JANINA" collided with the F/V "NOORDZE" whilst anchored 25 miles W-SW of Hoek Van Holland, Netherlands at 0300 hours on 26/07/2010 in good weather. It sustained damage to port aft hull took water in engine room and accomodation and developed 15 degree list. No injuries or pollution were reported. The vessel was taken in tow to Scheldepoort shipyard for inspection. It was reported that damged were beyond economical repair and was breaking up in August 2010.

On 25 July 2010 at approximately 2220 LT, OCEAN EMPEROR suffered a main engine failure.  At the time of the engine failure, the vessel in position Lat 15° 24.6’S, Long 147° 40.6’E, approximately 30 nautical miles due east of the Bougainville Reef.  The vessel was adrift near this position until approximately 1430 LT on 27 July 2010, when OCEAN EMPEROR was taken under tow by the tug PACIFIC RESPONDER.  At the time the vessel was taken under tow, it was drifting toward the environmentally sensitive Great Barrier Reef.  When the vessel was taken under tow by the tug, the drift toward the Great Barrier Reef was brought under control and the risk of pollution was averted.  OCEAN EMPEROR was towed to a position near Cairns, Australia, where repairs were undertaken and an investigation was conducted. There were no injuries to the crew or pollution reported.

On 25th July 2010, the vessel was securely moored at the Oil Terminal Jetty no. 1 for loading.  Loading operation was uneventful until about 1540 when the ship was in the process of topping off COT nos. 7 port and starboard.  The ullage meter fitted on COT no. 7 port read 1.31 m.  Some time later, whilst the chief officer, the pump man and the AB were monitoring the cargo operation and the meters, they observed that no. 7 ullage meter remained fixed on the 1.31 m level, whilst the pump man noticed oil overflowing.  The cargo operation was stopped and cargo transfer commenced immediately to reduce the pressure inside the tank.  In the process, approximately 250 litres of fuel were lost overboard.

25 JULY 2010 AT ABOUT 1235 HRS WHILE COMING OUT FROM ENGINE ROOM FOR LUNCH, CHIEF ENGINEER NOTICED THAT ONE OF AFT MOORING ROPE WAS FALLING IN SEA. CHIEF ENGINEER ASKED 4TH ENGINEER TO INFORM BRIDGE. IN ABOUT 5 MINUTES, CHIEF OFFICER AND SECOND OFFICER ALONG WITH DECK CREW CAME AFT. CHIEF ENGINEER, SECOND ENINEER AND 4TH ENGINEER ALSO GAVE A HELPING HAND FOR SECURING & SHIFTING OF ROPES TO FUNNEL DECK. WHILE CREW WAS WORKING, A HUGE SWELL SUDDENLY CAME ON AFT POOP DECK.  WHEN SEAS CLEARED FROM DECK CREW SAW THAT CHIEF ENGINEER MR PATANKAR MUSTAPHA DAOOD AND ONE AB MR. VIJAYAN VATTAYUZHATHIL JAYA PRAKASH WERE SWEPT OFF TO SEA AT 1245 HRS. THE VESSEL WAS AT SANDHEADS ANCHORAGE, BAY OF BENGAL IN POSITION 21º 00.2´N, 088º 05.4 E. LIFE BUOYS WERE THROWN INTO SEA. SEARCH WAS CARRIED OUT BY SHIP AS WELL AS BY SHORE HELICOPTERS BUT FUTILE AND CREW WAS UNABLE TO RECOVER CASUALTIES.

At about 1: 15 p.m. the First Officer informed me that two passengers fell down in the water from the walkway of the terminal which was situated at the aft of the ship on deck 7. 
Immediately the emergency medical service was activated with all the medical equipment available on board. Immediately I went to the dock and saw the Chief Security, the A/B Sailor, the Fireman, the foreman in the water succouring the persons fallen in the sea and the doctor and the nurse on the dock with all the medical equipment. 
At 1:25 p.m. the first guest who fell in the water was rescued and identified as a 65 years old, Spanish, born on the 17/03/1945 (cabin number 10066), shocked, but reactive. 
At about 1:40 pm the second passenger was rescued with the help of the rubber dinghy of the harbour office. The passenger was a 62 years old, Spanish, born the 26/11/1948 (cabin 10012). In the moment of the happening, the ship was docked from starboard on the dock "Doria Levante" with 3 ropes and 2 springs in the forward part and 5 ropes and 3 springs in the aft. No operation of loading / unloading of provisions and bunkering was taking place. 
The weather report was from 5 to 12 miles/h NNW. 
As per a control on our cameras, we noticed a sudden slipping of the telescopic walkway in the direction of the dock due probably to the inclination and the absence of brake of the walkway. The walkway of the terminal is exclusively controlled by the personnel of the terminal. 
At about 2:30 I was informed about the dead of the 62 years old passenger.

Día 24 julio, siendo las 09:00 horas el señor José BANCAYAN Quiroga, propietario de la embarcación pesquera GUIAME SEÑOR DEL MAR, informó que su embarcación se encuentra al garete por fallas mecánicas en la posición Latitud 05° 00`S y Longitud 081° 48`W, con SEIS (06) tripulantes a bordo, CAPIPITA, activó RCC, se dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera Marítima RIO OCOÑA, Patrullera de Costa CHORRILLOS y la aeronave FOCKER F-60 que efectuó la exploración aeromarítima, el día 27 julio, la Motonave RIO BRAVO informó que estableció contacto con la embarcación al garete, informando su posición, el mismo día a 20:10 horas la Patrullera Marítima ubicó a la citada embarcación pesquera en la posición Latitud 03° 23`S y Longitud 081° 16`W, procediendo a efectuar el remolque hacia la Caleta CANCAS, donde arribaron el día 28 julio a 05:00 horas.

SOLASStatus: JULA S: SOLAS, ZENITH WINNER: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents: At 05:54 hrs on 24 July 2010, a collision occurred between the container ship Jula S, which sails under the flag of Germany, and the coaster Zenith Winner, which is registered in the Republic of Korea, about 25 nm east of Chinese port of Tianjin in fog. Visibility was considerably less than one nautical mile. The Jula S was on a westerly course towards the roads of Tianjin. The Zenith Winner left Tianjin at 03:15 hrs and steered continuously on a head-on course towards the open sea. In the (radar) view of the ships command of the Jula S, up until about 2.5 minutes before the collision and at a distance of approximately 1 nm between the two ships, everything pointed towards an uncomplicated “green – green” passage with a passing distance of approximately 0.3 nm. However, as confirmed by the AIS recordings of vessel Traffic Service (VTS) Tianjin, the Zenith Winner began to turn to starboard at this point for no apparent reason. At about 05:53 hrs, this sudden and unpredictable change in course was noticed on the bridge of the Jula S, which responded with a hard to starboard coursed change and “full astern” as a last moment action shortly after. However, at this point the distance between the two ships was no longer great enough to avoid the collision. The bulbous bow of the Jula S ploughed into the port side of the Zenith Winner leaving an indentation some 3 metres deep in the areas at which the superstructure and cargo hold meets and caused a massive inrush of water there. The Zenith Winner slowly began to founder about 15 minutes after the collision. All ten crew members abandoned the ship and escaped in a liferaft. The Jula S only sustained minor damages to the bulbous bow and one of her lifeboats made for the liferaft and towed it to the Jula S. The survivors were taken on board the container ship with no serious injuries

El día 22 de Julio de 2010, a las 15:45 horas, estando el buque atracado en el puerto de Altamira, en México y durante la realización de operaciones de carga y descarga, el marinero SANDEEP SHIVAJI KAKADE, quien se encontraba en la cubierta 01 en popa (Cross deck), realizaba actividades de aseguramiento de la carga, en la bahía 32 en popa, cuando observo que una de la barras largas de soporte y aseguramiento de un contenedor no se encontraba colocada, por lo que procedió a tratar de levantarla y colocarla en cubierta, perdiendo el equilibrio por el peso, cayendo de pie en la cubierta de popa. Inmediatamente, los estibadores que se encontraban en el lugar de los acontecimientos, procedieron a notificar al tripulante (AB) de guardia en el portalón del buque, quien a su vez alertó al Oficial de Guardia (Segundo Oficial). El primer Oficial, al percatarse de la situación, corrió a la popa y encontró al marino SANDEEP SHIVAJI KAKADE, tirado sobre la cubierta de popa. Cayó parado y manifestaba dolor en la parte baja de la espalda y pierna derecha. Fue atendido en cubierta, trasladándolo posteriormente hasta su camarote, quedando de reposo. El Capitán también fue notificado inmediatamente. Los estibadores procedieron a informar al personal de primeros auxilios en tierra, quienes se presentaron a bordo y evaluaron la condición física del marino, determinando que no tenía fracturas, y procediendo a aplicar bálsamo en las partes del cuerpo afectadas y suministrándole analgésicos. Le indicaron reposo en su camarote, y le aconsejaron ser visto por un medico en el próximo puerto de Veracruz, si persistían los dolores. Posteriormente, al arribar al puerto de Veracruz, el marino SANDEEP SHIVAJI KAKADE, fue evacuado a un hospital en tierra don de debería permanecer al menos 72 horas, para realizar exámenes complementarios y determinar las lesiones que le continuaban produciendo dolor.

Location: A 18 MILLAS A LA CUADRA DE PUNTA PARIÑAS - TALARA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 20 julio, siendo las 10:00 horas, el señor Miguel MAZA, Patrón de la embarcación pesquera JOEL, informó que se encuentran al garete por fallas mecánicas en la posición 04º 54’S y Longitud 081º 34’W, CAPILARA, activó RCC, a 10:15 horas dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa CHORRILLOS, siendo las 13:30 horas la Patrullera de Costa ubicó a la embarcación pesquera JOEL, procediendo a remolcarla hacia Puerto Talara.

On July 19, 2010 at approximately 1642LT, the Liberian flag crude oil tanker, TRIDONAWATI (IMO No. 9000534) was grounded while in the Suez Canal, Egypt; there were two pilots on board when the vessel went aground. The pilots had ordered a course of 171 (T). During the transit of the vessel around 151 – 152 km marks, the channel narrows down. This led to the Bank Cushion Effect and the vessel took a rapid starboard sheer and TRIDONAWAIT developed a starboard swing. The pilot ordered wheel hard over to port and the starboard swing was corrected, however, the TRIDONAWATI then developed a port swing. The pilot could not control the port swing, at 1632 hrs LT the TRIDONAWATI’s port bow came in contact with the bottom of the Suez Canal at151.8 KM. The bow of the vessel slowly swung back into the canal. After the grounding, flooding in the forepeak tank & 1 P water ballast tank was observed. Vessel was able to steer under own power and continued out of Suez Canal. There were no injuries on board and the vessel reported no hull damage or pollution.

InitialEvent: Hull failure / failure of watertight doors / ports, etc.
SummaryOfEvents: At 13.13 BST on 19th July 2010, the dumb barge Henty Supplier, loaded with approximately 1850m³ of gas oil, suffered a catastrophic failure of her hull while alongside Huskisson Dock in Liverpool.   Approximately 50m³ of the gas oil spilled into the dock, but was quickly contained by terminal and port authority personnel. There were no injuries but the barge was a constructive total loss.

SOLASStatus: HELLENIC SEA: SOLAS, NORSUL CRATEUS: Unknown/unspecified
SummaryOfEvents: MV Hellenic Sea was navigating an Amazon River passage under local pilotage, heading to Vila Do Conde, Brazil to Trombetas, Brazil.  At about 0015, on 17 July 2010, the vessel made a port turn due to an inbound vessel.  MV Hellenic Sea subsequently ran aground and water ingress was reported in the forepeak tank, No.1 and 2 starboard double bottoms and no. 1 cargo hold.  Attempts to pump out the water from the flooded compartments proved unsuccessful since the rate of water ingress was higher than the pumps’ capacities.  Seeing that the vessel’s forward draft kept increasing, and in view of the developing shear forces and bending moments, the master decided to beach the vessel.  Following the preparation and implementation of a salvage plan, the vessel was subsequently refloated on 14 August 2010.

The general cargo ship "EIFFEL PLANET" capsized and sank circa 15 nautical miles South of the Ivory Coast at 1224 Hours on 16/07/2010. All 13 crew members were rescued at 0200 Hours on 17/07/2010 by M/V "DON GIOVANNI" and taken to Dakar, Senegal. No injuries or pollution were reported.

While shooting a string of Lobster pots on the morning of 15th July 2009 from the MFV MDAC off Fenit, Co. Kerry, a crew member's leg became caught in a loop of rope and he was pulled over the side.

The skipper stopped the engine and hauled the crew member back on board the boat, but was unable to resuscitate him. The crew member died due to acute cardio-respiratory failure and drowning.

On 14th July 2010 at approximately 14.00 hours a loud explosion occurred on the offshore Processing Ship (FPSO) PETROBRAS XXXIII, (IMO 7357749, Call Sign 3FKZ6, MMSI 356790000, Gross tonnage 135673, DWT 279749 tons, built 1978, Flag  Panama).  Prelimininary analysis indicated a counterpressure inside the equipment (a fact to be confirmed). There were no injuries to any personnel, nor was there any pollution. 
The accident is under investigation. No other details have been obtained up to this time. Further details will be issued when available.

When transiting a ship canal, a 140000grt chemical tanker grounded soon after the vessel failed to respond to starboard helm. The rudder appeared to be stuck at port 20, so the master elected to continue to turn hard to port to try and remain within the navigable channel. As the vessel  turned  through 180 degrees, the CPP was put to full astern and the anchor was dropped but this failed to prevent the vessel from grounding on soft mud at a speed of about 5 kts. The ship was not damaged.Following the internal transfer of ballast tanks, the tanker was re-floated with the assistance of 4 tugs. The vessel then anchored. Underwater inspection of the rudder identified that about 40% of the upper part of the Becker flap was missing. The link pin had dropped out of the skeg and the linkage system was also missing. The vessel was towed to a repair yard. When in dry dock, the supporting plate for the middle hinge of the remaining flap was severely wasted. Investigation concluded that the corresponding plate on the upper flap had probably been in a similar condition before failing.

M/T “Chemstar Belle” was loaded with a consignment of Chemicals in bulk (7809.827 M/T) from Durban & Richard Bay (Voyage No.47) to be discharged at Kandla & Jebel Ali Ports, respectively.
However, the vessel started to encounter heavy weather and sea conditions since 06:00hrs L.T on 13.07.2010. Moreover, at about 19:00 hrs (L.T.) on the same date, the AB (Anastacio) witnessed the vessel’s Master (Capt. Jacek Cichomski) laying face down and blood coming out from his back skull, ear and nose.
The Master’s leg was on stairway and his head was on the floor, near to Boson’s cabin at the boat deck level. Several attempts were made by the vessel’s crew in order to save the Master’s Life. However, no positive results were achieved in that regard. The accident took place, when the   vessel was at   position 28° 20.9’ S & 35° 19.6’ E. Finally, the Master was declared dead and the Chief Officer took over the vessel’s command.

Día 12 julio, siendo las 09:10 horas, la embarcación pesquera GENIO II, informó que se encuentra al garete por fallas mecánicas, desde el día 11 de julio a 11:00 horas en la posición Latitud 22º 15’S y Longitud 074º 17’W, con CUATRO (04) tripulantes a bordo, el día 13 julio, la embarcación pesquera GENIO-I zarpó desde la Caleta Morro Sama, llevando repuestos y accesorios a fin de reparar las fallas mecánicas de la embarcación en emergencia, el día 16 julio a 21:30 horas, arribó la embarcación pesquera GENIO II a la Caleta Morro Sama remolcado por la embarcación pesquera GENIO I.

Nature of Incident: Fire O" board 
 

 
Any Injury to crew Any damage to Ship Any Damage to Cargo Any Pollution 
 

: 1 Missing, 2 sustained burn injury : Yes (Cargo and ballast tank). 
: Nil 
: NIL 
 

 
Vessel sailed from Vietnam on 10lh Jul 2010, 0630 L T and was en route to Kuantan to load various charter~r's cargo with ETA 12/1500 LT. Vessel was involved in final stage of tank cleaning when a fire occurred in 4P cargo oil tank in position Lat 0412.9 N, 10432.8 E at 0945 LT (0145 UTC) on 1ih Jul 2010. The fire brought under control by ship's crew. The vessel sustained tank rupture but vessel is under own power. Vessel now searching for the missing crew in accordance with guidelines stated in IAMSAR VOL 111. Master advised shipping in vicinity to look for the missing crew. 
Company requested assistance from regional MRCC (MRSC Kuantan & Singapore) to search for the missing crew and evacuate the injured 2 crew. Necessa~ medical advice has been provided by SEACARE. 2 Injured Crew immediately evacuated @ 1i July 2010 @ 1645 Hrs By Malaysian Authority

The bulk carrier "LOK RAJESHWARI" caught fire in the engine room in the Gulf of Oman after leaving Fujairah on 10/07/2010. The damages were beyond economical repair and subsequently sold for breaking up. 
The blaze was extinguished by the crew. No injuries were reported. The ship sustained severe damage to engine room and accomodation.

Le vendredi 9 juillet, le transbordeur Seven Sisters, exploité par la compagnie LD TRANSMANCHE FERRIES sur la ligne Dieppe-Newhaven, est amarré tribord à quai au poste ferry de Newhaven (Grande-Bretagne). A Newhaven, les opérations d’embarquement/débarquement de véhicules se font par l’avant du navire. A 22h40 TU, les passagers et véhicules accompagnés ont débarqué et les remorques non-accompagnées sont en cours de déchargement. L'appareillage est prévu à 23h30.
La rampe d'accès à la plate-forme voiture du pont 4 bâbord est bloquée. Le chef mécanicien demande de disposer de la plate-forme élévatrice mobile de personnes
(PEMP) au pont 4 pour intervenir sur les pièces en cause.
La PEMP est conduite, par le second maître, de son poste de mer à l'arrière tribord du pont 3, au pied de la rampe mobile tribord qui permet l'accès au pont 4. Elle est engagée sur la rampe et stationnée en bas de celle-ci, juste au dessus de la charnière de la bavette (ou flap).
La PEMP ne peut monter par ses propres moyens la rampe en position basse; il est donc décidé de procéder au hissage de la rampe pour diminuer sa pente. Le maître d'équipage est positionné au poste de commande de la rampe au pont 3, dans l'attente de l'autorisation de montée qui lui est donnée par le second maître du poste « homme mort » au pont 4.
Vers 22h55, quand l'extrémité de la rampe est relevée d'environ 1,5 m le second maître, sans attendre que la rampe ait atteint la position horizontale du pont.4, reprend sa place dans le panier de la PEMP pour la mettre en mouvement.
Au cours de cette manœuvre, la PEMP recule, saute le décrochement entre la rampe et la bavette et tombe sur le pont 3 en se retournant. Dans ce mouvement, le bras du panier se déplie et projette le conducteur contre la cloison tribord en le blessant grièvement à la tête et au thorax. La PEMP qui, dans sa chute a pris de la vitesse, termine sa course contre cette cloison en écrasant la jambe du maître d'équipage.
Les premiers soins sont dispensés à bord et, après médicalisation, les deux blessés sont évacués vers l'hôpital de Brighton.

Location: FRENTE A LA CALETA CABO BLANCO - TALARA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 09 julio, siendo las 16:00 horas, el señor Harold AHUMADA Kián, propietario de la embarcación pesquera SUMIKO, informó que su embarcación se encuentra al garete por problemas mecánicos en la posición Latitud 04º 46’S y Longitud 082º 04’W, con TRES (03) tripulantes a bordo, CAPILARA, activó RCC, emitió Aviso de Capitanía, el día 11 y 12 julio la Patrullera Marítima RIO OCOÑA, efectuó búsqueda con resultados negativos, el día 13 julio, siendo las 08:30 horas la embarcación pesquera SUMIKO arribó a la caleta Cabo Blanco, remolcado por la embarcación pesquera LUMINOSO.

Día 09 julio, siendo las 14:30 horas, el señor Miguel YENQUE Navarro, propietario de la embarcación pesquera SAN PABLO, informó que su embarcación se encuentra al garete por problemas mecánicos en la posición Latitud 04º 48'S y Longitud 081º 52’W, con CINCO (05) tripulantes a bordo, CAPILARA, activó RCC y emitió Aviso de Capitanía, el día 10 julio, siendo las 09:00 horas el propietario informó que su embarcación arribó al Puerto de Talara remolcado por la embarcación pesquera NAZARENO.

On the afternoon of 09 July 2010, the small passenger ship Le Survenant III sailed from its home port on the Chenal du Moine, east of Sorel, Quebec, with 49 passengers and crew for a 90 minute tour of the Sorel Islands. On the return leg of the voyage, the ship encountered a heavy squall and, in near-zero visibility, grounded near the mouth of the Chenal des Raising at 14:35 hrs. No one was injured, nor was there any damage to the ship.

About 02.00 hours on 9th July 2010, the vessel left the Triigi Harbour to gather seaweed approximately 6-7 miles from the harbour. At 08.00 hours the vessel capsized as the seaweed was being lifted onto the vessel, having been overloaded.  The vessel sank in 7 meters of water, and two persons were lost. On 03.08.2010 the wreck was refloated and towed to the Triigi Harbour for repairs.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Ship rendered unfit to proceed

SummaryOfEvents:
The ODIN PACIFIC departed from Ghent in ballast for Uusikaupunk, Finland, on 6 July 2010. The bridge team at the time of grounding was 2nd officer and one Able seaman. The master went to sleep at 23.00 hours after having been on bridge for a short while. He woke up at 03.15 hours because of vibrations in the vessel and went quickly to bridge, as did the chief officer. On the bridge was the bridge team.

The master stopped the engine, he could see shore right ahead, he was slightly confused and began finding out what had happened. He could see that no change of course had been carried out as there should have been.

Prior to this watch the 2nd officer did not sleep as usual, but he had 5 – 6 cans of beer (4,7%). He drank these cans of beer from 1900 – 2200 hours in his cabin celebrating the good news that his military service had been postponed. 

When taking over the watch at 24.00 hours he felt intoxicated. He took over the watch from the 3rd officer, who however stayed on the bridge for approximately ½ hour because of traffic. The 2nd officer sent down the Able seaman to the mess room because the Able seaman had complained of pain in his foot. It was agreed that the 2nd officer would call for the Able seaman if necessary – heavy traffic or the like. He had never navigated in the Baltic Sea before.

The 2nd officer had set out waypoints for the passage and the autopilot was in service. Vessel’s speed was appr. 14 knots. An alarm was set to give a signal at change of course more than 0.3 cable, a constantly beeping sound. The alarm sound was not loud, and he did not hear it.

After appr. 0215 hours, the 2nd officer does not remember any more because he fell asleep in the chair on the bridge. He suddenly woke up at 03.15 hours observing shore right ahead. After the grounding, he called for the master, who was already on his way to the bridge.

The 2nd officer is of the opinion that the grounding was not caused by lack of sleep but by alcohol consumption.

At the grounding some damage occurred to ballast and fuel tanks. No pollution.

Le 08 Juillet 2010, en début de soirée, le navire de pêche Janeiro appareille du port de Saint-Quay Portrieux avec deux hommes à bord, pour se rendre sur son lieu de pêche situé entre les Heaux de Bréhat et les Sept Iles. Il est géré par le chalut de fond. Il est accompagné par le navire de pêche Jadys. 

Les conditions météorologiques sont bonnes.

Arrivé au large de Bréhat à 20:30 heures, le chalut est mis à l’eau pour un premier trait. Vu la faible quantité de poissons prise, le patron décide de faire route à milles environ dans le Nord-Ouest de la bouée cardinale « La Jument ».

Alors que le navire est de nouveau en pêche, avec un cap au 090°, vers 02 :00 heures le 09 juillet, le patron décide de changer de route et de prendre un cap au 270° et de venir bout au courant. La  barre est mise 25° à bâbord. Dès la manœuvre engagée, le patron se rend sur le pont arrière où le matelot travaille au tri de la pochée précédente.

A ce moment, une croche soudaine fait gîter le navire sur l’arrière bâbord. L’eau s’engouffre  dans le puits et envahit les compartiments sous-pont.

Les deux membres d’équipage se jettent à l’eau et rejoigne le radeau de sauvetage. Un tir de fusée rouge attire l’attention du navire de pêche Jadys qui fait route de conserve avec le Janeiro depuis la veille.

Le Janeiro sombre à la position 48° 58’,2 N – 003° 19’,2 W.

Les deux naufragés sont récupérés sains et saufs par le Jadys qui fait aussitôt route vers le port de Saint-Qay Portrieux

On July 8, 2010 at approximately 2150 hours, the Liberian flagged chemical tanker, FPMC 23 laden with over 11,000 metric tons of pyrolysis gasoline, was involved in a grounding incident near Dayapai Dao Island while underway to Dongguan, China from Ulsan Korea. After altering course to narrowly avoid a collision with the Qatari flagged LPG tanker, BU SIDRA, the FPMC 23 attempted to resume her course. While manoeuvring, the FPMC 23 encountered a dark object approximately 200 meters off her starboard bow. At approximately 2150, FPMC 23 grounded.  The crew rushed to assess the damage and measure all ballast, cargo and fuel oil tanks and the depth of water that surrounded the ship, which was found to have the FPT flushed with sea water; ballast tanks 1P and 2P were broken and had lost water.  However, there was no observed damage to the other ballasts, cargo or fuel oil tanks. There were no injuries or incidents of pollution reported. FPMC 23 was successful in conducting refloating operations without tug assistance.  The ship proceeded to port and safely anchored at the No. 12TZ anchorage under the instruction of Guishan VTS.

At about 0830 on 8 July 2010, an oiler on board the ship was struck on the head by the top of a 200 lt drum while attempting to remove the top with a grinder. He died a short time later from the injuries he sustained.

On 7 July 2010, CHARLOTTE MAERSK was en route from Port Klang, Malaysia bound for Salalah, Oman. At 2119 on 7 July 2010 approximately three hours after departure crew members on the bridge observed smoke rising from the forward part of the ship.
It was soon apparent that there was a rapidly developing fire on deck. The fire alarm was activated and the crew mustered according to the muster plan and started the fire fighting efforts.
After approximately 24 hours of fire fighting by the crew members, support ships and a fire fighting aeroplane, the fire was considered to be under control. From the evening of 9 July 2010, the fire fighting effort was organised by a salvage master and fire fighters from ashore assisted by the ship’s crew.
On 18 July 2010, CHARLOTTE MAERSK sailed under own power to the Port of Tan-jung Pelepas, Malaysia to discharge the cargo. The fire fighters from ashore were de-mobilized on 22 July 2010.
There were only minor damages to the hull and deck and some deformation due to heat on two hatches of cargo hold no. 6. Approximately 160 containers were damaged.
One crew member subsequently suffered respiratory problems from inhaling smoke from the fire.
A certificate of commendation from the IMO was awarded to the crew of Charlotte Maersk for their acts of bravery during the fire in July 2010.

On 7th July 2010 the bunker vessel TAMINA departed from Dalanas, Gothenburg, en route to Masthuggskajen, about 1.6 nautical miles away, where the vessel berthed at the platform below the loading ramps for the high speed craft Stena Carisma.
