On 9 February 2010 at 10:45, under freezing conditions, the ship 'ALUSHTA' caught fire in hold whilst undergoing repairs at Krasnaya Kuznitsa shipyard, Arkhangelsk, Russia. The blaze spread to accomodation and after several hours was extinguished by local fire fighters. The accommodation sustained severe damage and four shipyard workers sustained smoke inhalation injuries and were taken to local hospitals.

On February 9th, 2010, at approximately 02.30 hours, the vessel departed the Port of
Quebec, Section 50 en route to Kristiansand, Norway in order to discharge a cargo of
nickel matte loaded at the Port of Quebec.

On the same day, at approximately 03.50 hours, the M/V ALGOMA DISCOVERY
experienced a loss of propulsion. At approximately 03.55 hours, the starboard anchor was
dropped. This corrective action did not sufficiently stop the vessel and at approximately
04.02 hours, the M/V ALGOMA DISCOVERY grounded on the north side of the St.
Lawrence Channel, in the vicinity of Saint-Laurent-de-l’Ile-d’Orleans. Shortly after the
grounding occurred, sounding of ballast tank and cargo hold bilges were taken and no
water ingress was noted. The grounding caused no pollution.

On the bridge at that time were the Master, the Officer of the Watch (OOW), the
helmsman, and two pilots. The Master and the OOW were certified to the standards
required for a vessel the size of the M/V ALGOMA DISCOVERY and for the intended
type of voyage.

A refloating plan was prepared by vessel Owners and submitted to Transport Canada
Marine Safety for their approval. The plan consisted of de-ballasting approximately 2,000
MT of water ballast from the fore peak and two (2) tugs fastened to the vessel, one to
forward shoulder and the second to centre lead aft. The stability, longitudinal shear and
bending moment and stress were calculated and approved by the Class ABS Consulting
SMP. Said plan was approved by Transport Canada Marine Safety and Canadian Coast
Guard. The vessel was successfully refloated on the same day at 12.09 hours and
proceeded to Port of Quebec for further inspection.

Location: A 42 MILLAS A LA CUADRA BAHIA TALARA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 07 febrero, siendo las 08:30 horas se recepcionó llamada telefónica del señor xxx, Presidente Gremio Pescadores Artesanales de Mancora, informando que la embarcación pesquera MI MANUEL ALEJANDRO, se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas en la posición latitud 04° 16`S y longitud 081° 47`W, a 42 millas a la cuadra de Talara, con seis (06) tripulantes a bordo, CAPILARA, activo RCC, a 08:45 horas se dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera Marítima BAP RIO PIURA, a 14:05 horas la Patrullera Marítima ubicó en la posición latitud 04° 14`S y longitud 081° 36`W, la citada embarcación fue remolcada a la Caleta Mancora.

The general cargo ship "KARTAL CK" caught fire whilst undergoing repairs at Dogonlar, Erdek, Turkey at 1920 hours on 06/02/2010. It was subsequently broken up in Turkey. The blaze was extinguished with assistance from local fire services. 1 crew member was dead.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

Location: Kennacraig terminal, West Loch Tarbert, Kintyre. UK
SummaryOfEvents:
At 0855 on 6 February 2010, the UK registered ro-ro passenger ferry Isle of Arran, struck the linkspan in Kennacraig, West Loch Tarbert, Kintyre at a speed of over 8kts. The vessel was on passage from Port Askaig to Kennacraig, with 14 passengers and 24 crew on board. There were no injuries but both the vessel and the linkspan were damaged. 
The accident occurred after control of the starboard propeller pitch was lost due to a mechanical failure. Consequently, the starboard propeller remained at full ahead as the ferry made her approach to the berth. Although the port propeller was put to full astern, the starboard anchor was let go, and the starboard engine was shut down, this did not prevent Isle of Arran from landing heavily on the linkspan. 
Factors leading to the mechanical failure included the fitting of a manufacturer’s original spare component which was incorrect, a lack of technical information leading to incorrect adjustment, inadequate testing of the pitch control system, and the lack of a robust technical investigation following a previous failure.  There was no test of the pitch control system before Isle of Arran was committed to the final approach into Kennacraig.  As a consequence, the high speed of approach to the berth and the inability of the ship’s crew to quickly identify the cause of the loss of pitch control, made the resultant heavy contact with the linkspan inevitable.

During the early hours of 6th February 2010 MT Summity collided with Mucking Number 3 buoy, on The River Thames, while inbound to Grays Terminal, in ballast condition and under pilotage.  A response team was initiated and managed the situation from the Barrow office. 
There was no injury to any personnel and no pollution as a result of this incident. The vessel did however sustain damage to the propeller.

On February 5, 2010 at approximately 0718 hrs (LT), the Liberian flag bulk carrier vessel, VOGETRADER (IMO No. 9108269) was grounded while entering the channel at Barber’s Point, Hawaii. The pilot was on board when the vessel went aground at the entrance between two buoys. The United States Coast Guard and the Pilot Association provided assistance using 5 tugs to refloat VOGETRADER from aground. At approximately 1448 (LT) the vessel was refloated and clear from the channel.

At approximately 19:13 hours on 2 February 2010, a fire broke out in the auxiliary engine room on board the Bahamas registered roll-on roll-off passenger ferry Oscar Wilde. The ferry had just sailed from Falmouth, UK, after completing her annual docking. The seat of the fire was in way of the auxiliary engines’ fuel supply module and quickly spread across the compartment. The fire was eventually extinguished by the ship’s crew at 21:00 hours. There were no passengers on board and none of the ship’s crew was injured. However, the fire caused the ship to lose electrical power, which ultimately required her to be towed back into Falmouth for repairs.

On 1 February 2010 at approximately 1700 hours, the launch MARTIN N was engaged to transfer a chief engineer who had been on leave from shore to the oil and chemical tanker OW COPENHAGEN that was at anchor on Copenhagen roads.

The chief engineer refused to don a lifejacket when urged to so by the launch skipper and later on also by two crewmembers on the tanker who were ready at the pilot ladder to receive and assist the chief engineer.

When shifting from the launch to the tanker, the chief engineer suddenly lost his grip on the pilot ladder and fell into the water without a sound.

The launch was manned by the skipper only, and he managed to fetch the chief engineer. But due to the cold he could hold him for 5 -10 minutes only.

The MOB boat from OW COPENHAGEN was launched, and a search and rescue operation was initiated with the participation of several vessels, another MOB boat from a ro-ro passenger ship and a rescue helicopter.

The chief engineer was recovered after approximately 50 minutes and showed no signs of life and soon after, when taken to hospital by helicopter, he was declared dead.

In February 2010, the passenger ship PLATINUM II became stranded after dragging its anchor 6 miles south of Gopnath, India.  The ship had been anchored and was awaiting beaching permission at Alang, India.  No injuries or pollution were reported.  In March 2010, the hull became severely hogged and was later broken up using a floating crane.

Location: 25 nautical miles south of Hodeidah port, Yemen
SummaryOfEvents: On 2nd November 2010 a fire broke out in the engine room of the livestock carrier GAMMA LIVESTOCK, which was en route from Jeddah to Berbera, Somalia. The crew abandoned ship and the vessel eventually ran aground 20 metres from the coast of Hodeidah port. The Maritime Affairs Authority is conducting an investigation of events.

SOLASStatus: MONTE TOLEDO: Unknown/unspecified, SANKO BLOSSOM: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents:
During lightering approaching M/T Monte Toledo’s stbd side bridge wing passing under M/T Sanko Blossom’s port side bridge wing.
M/T Sanko Blossom mainly paint damage under port side bridge wing.
M/T Monte Toledo bridge wing was considerable, mainly the outer 4 moter of the bulwarks, one flood light was destroyed as was the man-overboard life-buoy.

Location: A 45 MILLAS FRENTE AL PUERTO SALAVERRY
SummaryOfEvents: Dia 30 enero, a 10:40 horas, se recibió llamada telefónica del Patrón de la embarcación pesquera ADRIAN JOSUE, manifestando que se encuentran al garete por fallas mecanicas en posicion latitud 08° 08`S y longitud 079° 38`W, a 11:20 horas se dispuso el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costa INDEPENDENCIA, a 15:15 horas la Patrullera de Costa, ubicó a la embarcación pesquera ADRIAN JOSUE, en la posicion latitud 08° 01`S y longitud 079° 39`W, con siete (07) tripulantes a bordo, a 22:30 horas arribó la Patrullera de Costa al Puerto Salaverry, remolcando a la citada embarcación.

Location: A 10 MILLAS AL NORTE DEL PUERTO DE PACASMAYO
SummaryOfEvents: Dia 29 enero, a 12:30 horas se recibió llamada telefónica del Patrón de la embarcación pesquera MELLBRITH, manifestando que se encuentran al garete por fallas mecánicas en la posición latitud 07° 16`S y longitud 079° 39`W, CAPISALA, activó RCC, emitió Aviso de Capitania, asimismo se efectuó coordinaciones con la Unidad Naval Corbeta Misilera BAP SANCHEZ CARRION, el día 30 enero a 07:15 horas zarpó la citada Unidad Naval al área de búsqueda, a 10:50 horas ubicó a la embarcación pesquera MELLBRITH, entre Punta Cherrepe y Pacasmayo a 10 millas al norte Puerto Pacasmayo, se efectuó el rescate de los CINCO (05) tripulantes, y se efectuó el remolque de la embarcación a la  Caleta Pacasmayo.

Location: Alongside at west Thurrock , River Thames
SummaryOfEvents:
Sand Falcon was secured alongside a jetty when the trolley from its gantry-type stores crane detached and fell 7.5m, landing on the deck guardrails. The trolley weighed over 400kg and narrowly missed 7 people who were working nearby, either on the main deck or on the jetty ashore. The crane was being prepared to load ship’s stores at the time and it was not lifting any weight.

The failure was due to a combination of design flaws, lack of maintenance and weaknesses in the methods used for inspection and testing to assess the safety of the crane.

InitialEvent: Hull failure / failure of watertight doors / ports, etc.
SummaryOfEvents:
On 28 January 2010, the Dutch ship "DC Merwestone" left Klaipeda (Lithuania) for Bilbao (Spain) carrying a cargo of scrap iron. At sea that evening the bilge alarm sounded and water was observed to be flowing into the engine room. Despite efforts made to empty the bilges the engine room filled completely and several of the adjacent spaces were partially filled. 
The vessel managed to seek refuge at the port of Gdynia, Poland

Location: A 50 METROS FRENTE AL DESEMBARCADERO ARTESANAL ZORRITOS
SummaryOfEvents: Día 28 enero, a 1050 horas se tomó conocimiento del hundimiento de la embarcación pesquera BENDICION DE CRISTO, frente al desembarcadero artesanal de Zorritos, debido a  fuertes oleajes, la embarcacion se encontraba fondeada sin tripulantes a bordo.

VESSEL WAS AT ANCHOR IN ALGECIRAS BAY AT 2 POSITION 0.5 MILES FROM THE COAST WHEN BORD WOOTHER COME WITH WINDS OF FORCE 7-8, HEAVED UP ANCHOR AND STATED MAIN ENGINE AT FULL POWER. TO GET UNDER WAY AND GROUNDY, BUT WADS WERE STRONGER THAN MY ENGINES TO FROM THE VESSEL. SO VESSEL WEND AGROUND AFTER 1 HOUR TO REFLOAT THE VESSEL WITH MY ENGINES, BUT FORLED.

On January 27th 2010, the LEESWIG was en route from Glasgow to Lisboa when she collided with the fishing vessel Spes Bona. The incident occurred at night while the Chief Officer was on his watch. The weather was fair with good visibility, and partly clouded skies with only marginal wind. Neither vessel took evasive action as the Chief Officer of the LEESWIG mistook the green lights displayed on the fishing vessel  for the normal running lights of a power-driven vessel. When he realized it was a fishing vessel his Starboard wheel order was too late to avoid the collision. The incident resulted in hull damage to the fishing vessel, and there was no harm to any crew member or the surrounding environment. After the collision both vessels communicated via VHF to jointly confirm that no help was needed.

Location: Near Island Le grand Mez de Goelo
SummaryOfEvents: Le 27 Janvier 2010 en fin de matinée, le navire de pêche Kalon Breitz signale au CROSS Corsen qu’il vient de récupérer le corps d’un homme, à 3 miles à l’Est de Paimpol. Il s’agit du patron du coquiller Bon Retour qui péchait  seul la coquille à bord de son navire.  Malgré les secours prodigués par l’équipage du Kalon-Breitz  et par le SAMU, la victime ne peut-être réanimée. Le Bon Retour ayant été repéré peu après  par un autre navire  de pêche, il est remorqué jusqu’au port de Pors Even (Commune de Ploubazlanec).

On 26 January 2010, at 0510, the vessel departed from its pier out to sea.  The master, who at the time was alone on the bridge, was blinded by the deck light on the foremast.  He left his position on the bridge to switch off the light.  However, when he returned to the manoeuvring position, he noticed that the vessel was heading towards one of the small islands in the area.  Although he disengaged the autopilot and altered course hard to port, the vessel was too close to the island and eventually ran aground at a speed of five knots.

On 26 January 2010, at 0300 hrs, the cargo ship SEA ANGEL capsized and sank in the Taiwan Strait, 20 Nautical Miles off Yunlin, Taiwan China.  A search and rescue operation was effected.  Ten crew members were rescued by Taiwanese rescue helicopters.  One crew member died and 8 were reported missing.  Some oil pollution was reported in the sea.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Pollution,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: The M/V ALEXANDRA EXPRESS took water, capsized and sank after a collision with M/V JUPITER ACE whilst departing Douala port, Cameroon on 26 January 2010. It sustained damage to the port side. All 11 crew members were evacuated to safety. No pollution were reported.

On 25 January 2010 at 0330 Hrs, the ship "BETTY" foundered in the Caribbean Sea, 53 miles North of Jamaica. A USG HU-25 aircraft proceeded to the scene and located the liferaft with 4 crew on board.  All 4 were rescued and taken to Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. One crew member was reported missing.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: On 25 January 2010, an explosion on cargo ship RAWAN 1 was reported.  The ship sank whilst effecting repairs in the outer anchorage at Alexandria, Egypt.  Two crew members died and 9 were rescued.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

Location: Fehmarnbelt, 3 miles north of Fehman, Germany
SummaryOfEvents: On 24 January 2010, in Fehamarnbelt, 3 miles north of Fehman, Germany, the engine room of the ship 'ABILITY' caught fire. Initial attempts by the crew to extinguish the blaze, using C02 system proved unsuccessful.  It was later brought under control by the patrol vessel 'Havruen', rescue ship 'Wilhelm Kaisen', and the police boat 'Bad Duben'.  'ABILITY' was towed by tug 'Bugsier 16' and escorted by the anit-pollution ship 'Scharhoern' to Rostock, Germany where it was inspected.  No inuries were reported and the cause of the fire was due to a rupture in the fuel line.  'ABILITY' was deemed not financially viable for repair and arrived at Esbjerg on 27 April 2010 to be broken up.

Location: MUELLE 2-B DEL TERMINAL PORTUARIO DE SALAVERRY
SummaryOfEvents: Día 24 abril, siendo las 12:45 horas se produjo el hundimiento del Remolcador RIO MOCHE, en circunstancias en que se encontraba amarrado al muelle 2-B del Terminal Portuario Salaverry, según lo informado por el Gerente y Jefe de Operaciones de ENAPU S.A. Salaverry, se presento ligera capa de hidrocarburos, la cual fue retenida con barrera de contención, el día 14 abril la empresa SALVAMAR S.A. efectuo el reflotamiento del mencionado Remolcador.
An OS fell into the No. 2 hold.  He was transported to the hospital, where he died.  No one saw him fall so it is not known why he fell into the hold.

The deck fitter was assigned to carry out welding works on the port side bulwark on the main deck near No.5 cargo hold.  Two seamen were assigned to assist him but they were engaged in cutting steel plates in the vicinity.  The fitter was electrocuted when seas rushed through the opening between the bulwark and the main deck and his body became wet during the electric arc welding working.  The fitter was resuscitated by the ship's crew and later the assistance of HKMRCC was sought to airlift him to a hospital in HK, but he was certified dead at 1825 hours.

Location: 20 MILE SOUTH EAST OF PORT PIPAV
SummaryOfEvents: On 22nd January 2011 while the research survey vessel “Logos Searcher” was engaged in four point mooring using four anchors, no.1 Anchor winch (Starboard aft) stop working. It was observed that no.1 Anchor wire was on short stay and vessel was gradually listing to starboard side till she capsized and finally foundered. All crew evacuated the vessel and 25 crew out of 32 survived, 6 missing and one dead body was found.

The M/V ATHINA dragged anchor and stranded east of Kali Limenes, Crete, Greece on 22 January 2010 in heavy weather and requested assistance. It subsequently arrived Aliaga, Turkey on 25 April 2010 for breaking up. No pollution reported, 1 crew member reported chest pains and was evacuated to hospital.

Le 21 janvier 2010, après trois jours de pêche « en boeufs » avec un chalutier du même armement, L’EPAULARD pratique, seul, le chalut de fond.
 En fin de matinée, à l’issue de son premier trait à 7 milles de la côte, L’EPAULARD effectue un demi-tour par l’Ouest. Lorsque l’équipage est prêt pour virer le chalut, le navire suit un cap de secteur Est à 3,5 noeuds. Le patron est en timonerie, aux commandes de l’enrouleur, et le mécanicien est dans l’entrepont, aux commandes des treuils.
Le cul du chalut arrive le long du bord et comprend deux poches d’environ 1,5 tonne.
Une première poche est embarquée ; les méduses et indésirables sont évacués et moins d’une tonne de poisson est conservée sur le pont principal.
Lorsque la deuxième poche est prête à être ouverte sur le pont, L’EPAULARD prend une très forte gîte sur bâbord. Le patron n’a que le temps d’alerter L’ALBATROS de la situation et d’évacuer la timonerie ; les trois matelots sont éjectés à la mer. L’EPAULARD se couche alors à 90° puis se retourne complètement. Le mécanicien reste prisonnier sous le navire, puis revient à la surface, à demi inconscient. Malgré les efforts du patron et d’un matelot pour le soutenir et lui maintenir la tête hors de l’eau, il sera rapidement sans réaction.
Environ 15 minutes après s’être retourné, L’EPAULARD sombre par 50 mètres de fond.
Les secours s’organisent mais le mécanicien décède au cours de l’évacuation ; les autres naufragés seront sauvés.

Location: A 12 MILLAS CUADRA CALETA CABO BLANCO
SummaryOfEvents: Dia 21 enero a 08:25 horas, se recepcionó llamada telefónica del señor Santiago PERICHE, Patrón de la embarcación pesquera SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS, manifestando que se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas en la posicion latitud 04° 09`S y longitud 081° 25`W,  a 12 millas a la cuadra de la Caleta de Cabo Blanco, embarcación inicialmente zarpó de la Caleta Mancora el dia 18 enero a 11:00 horas con cuatro (04) tripulantes a bordo, CAPILARA, activo RCC, disponiendo el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costas CHORRILLOS, a 10:30 horas se ubicó a la citada embarcación, procediendo a remolcar hacia Caleta Cabo Blanco, a 13:15 horas arribaron a la citada Caleta.

At 2120LT 20th-January-2010, MV “YM INVENTIVE” collided with the fishing boat “Zhe xiang yu 28027” in the east China Sea, caused the Bulbous Bow of MV “YM INVENTIVE” damaged partially, the fishing boat capsized and all the seamen fallen into the water. Finally 8 of the crews were rescued, 4went missing and 2 of the rescued crews died on the way back to home port.

Dia 20 enero a 12:00 horas, se recepcionó llamada telefónica del Distrito 11 de la Guardia Costera (California) USA, informando que recibió comunicación de la Motonave ATLANTIS de bandera USA, informando que en la posición latitud 08° 31`S y longitud 080° 41`W, a 105 millas de costa frente al Puerto Salaverry, avistó a la embarcación pesquera FORTALEZA, con ocho (08) tripulantes a bordo, que se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas, citada Motonave auxilió y aprovisionó combustible, a 13:18 horas se realizó comunicación con la Motonave ATLANTIS, informando que la embarcación solucionó su problema y procedió a la zona de pesca por dos dias mas.

Two crew members were inside one of the cargo tanks doing maintenance on a hydraulic valve.  At about 0350, one of the crew members radioed for assistance, claiming difficulties due to the effect of hydrocarbon gases.  Several attempts were made to rescue the crew members and eventually one of them managed to crawl out.  The other crew member, however, lost consciousness and never made it out.  During the rescue operation, another crew member who accessed the cargo tank without personal aids, lost consciousness and passed away in the tank.

The accident took place 20 January 2010. EGESUND is a tug with a tonnage of 135.6 BT. The ship is built in 1994. During stay in port the ships chief engineer came back to the ship after a visit in the town of Thyborøn. At the day of the accident there were snow on the quay and it was freezing. 
When entering the ship he slipped on a provisional arrangement used as a gangway. The arrangement consisted of a wooden pallet 3 metres long. The chief engineer fell in the gap between the ship and quay. The fall was observed by a witness who alarmed the crew. The chief engineer was rescued by the crew and some bystanders. Subsequently he was hospitalized. At the fall the chief engineer suffered injuries to his back and chest.

On 19 January 2010, at 2200 hrs, the ship, ULLA caught fire, whilst moored at Beira, Mozambique.  By 1830 hrs, on 20 January 2010, the blaze has been extinguished by local fire services.  The ship was completely burnt out and reported as being damaged beyond economical repair.  No crew were on board at the time of the incident and no injuries were reported.

On 19 January 2010 at 2200 hrs, the trawler PESCAMAR TREZE caught fire whilst moored at Beira, Mozambique.  By 1830 hrs, on 20 January 2010, the blaze had been extinguished by the local fire services.  There were no crew on board at the time of the incident and no injuries were reported.  The trawler was completely burnt out and was reported to be damaged beyond economical repair.

Día 18 enero, siendo las 17:10 horas, el señor Wilfredo PRADO Timo, informó que la embarcación pesquera NICOLAS, se encuentra al garete por fallas mecanicas en la posicion latitud 10º 13’S y longitud 078º 46’W, la embarcacion zarpó el día 15 a 12:00 horas de la Caleta Puerto Chico – Barranca, con cinco (05) tripulantes a bordo, sin autorización de zarpe, CAPISUPE activó RCC, a 23:45 horas zarpó la Patrullera Marítima RIO NEPEÑA a fin de efectuar búsqueda, arribando el día 20 a 06:00 horas al Puerto Huarmey con resultados negativos en la búsqueda, el día 20 enero a 11:00 horas, se recibe comunicacion del propietario citada embarcacion informando que su embarcacion fue avistada el dia 19 a 20:00 horas al garete por una embarcación no identificada en la posición latitud 09º 10’S y longitud 079º 15’W, el día 20 enero, se recomiendó a JEDICAP-1 el zarpe de la Patrullera de Costas INDEPENDENCIA, asignada a CAPISALA, el dia 21 a 05:25 horas zarpó la citada Patrullera de Costa, retornando el mismo dia a 20:00 horas con resultados negativos, a 21:20 horas se presentó el señor Angel Jesús TORRES Velásquez, Patrón de la embarcación pesquera NICOLAS, informando que el día 19 fueron rescatados por una embarcación dedicada a extracción de pota en la posicion latitud 09º 10’S y longitud 079º 14’W, arribando a puerto Chimbote el día 20 a 06:00 horas.

The fishing vessel "GULF STREAM III" caught fire and sank 13 miles Southwest of Key west, Florida, USA at 12.30 Hours on 19/01/2010. The blaze was extinguished with assistance from local fire services. No injuries were reported.

On 19 January 2010, at 0300 hrs, under heavy weather conditions, the cargo ship ORCUN C, dragged anchor, stranded and broke in two at Kilyos, Turkey.  All 21 crew members were rescued with no injuries reported.  Tugs KURTAMA 3 and KURTAMA 4 attended to the scene.  Some oil leaked into the sea to which a clean-up operation was effected.  The wreck was removed in June 2010.

Location: 25 miles NW of Miaoli, Taiwan, China
SummaryOfEvents: On 19 January 2010, at 0030 hrs, in typhoon Megi, the cargo ship XIN YI sustained steering failure, took water and developed 15 degree list and sank about 25 miles NW of Miaoli, Taiwan, China.  Eighteen crew members were rescued by various ships, including the ship LEGEND OF THE SEAS and rescue boat COASTGUARD 5030.  One crew member died and 3 were reported missing.

The tanker "LIBRAGAS" stranded off Nuevitas, Cuba on 19/01/2010. It was subsequently refloated and sold for demolition in India. No injuries or pollution were reported. Salvage contract was signed under LOF. and arrived at Port of Spain, Trinidad for inspection.

The fishing vessel CALYPSO sustained steering failure and sank in the Caribbean Sea, 45 miles Northwest of Cartagena, Colombia on 18/01/2010 in heavy weather. All 18 crew members abandoned the ship. 15 crew members were rescued and 3 missing. A helicopter and a patrol plane assisted with the search operation.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

SummaryOfEvents: Dia 17 enero a 23:50 horas, el encargado del Puesto de Capitania de Ancon recibió comunicación de la Sra. Maria CABRERA Vigil, propietaria de la embarcación pesquera PAPU, manifestando que su embarcación se encontraba al garete por fallas mecánicas, frente al puerto de Chancay, con Cinco (05) tripulantes, informando ademas que su embarcación zarpó de la Bahía de Ancon; el dia 18 enero a 01:00 horas se recibió la comunicación de la propietaria de la citada embarcación, informando que la embarcación pesquera ESTRELLITAS MIAS, ubicó a su embarcación y que efectuara el remolque hacia el Puerto de Huacho.

The general cargo ship "ERTUG" stranded at Igneada, near Istanbul, Turkey on 17/01/2010 at 1920 Hours in heavy weather. No injuries or pollution were reported, the ship sustained severe damage. 6 crew members were rescued by rescue boats "TCSG-74" and "KEGIM-1". The shore based rescue team also attended the scene.

SOLASStatus: BAO YUE JIA: Unknown/unspecified, DELOS: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents: On January 14, 2010 at approximately 11.28LT, the Liberian Flag oil tanker, DELOS was involved in a collision with St. Vincent and Grenadines bulk carrier, BAO TUE JIA  while approaching the Chittagong Anchorage. As the DELOS was maneuvering toward its anchorage, the vessel contacted the anchored BAO YUE JIA on the DELOS’ port side. There were no injuries or pollution reported. The contact resulted in significant hull damage to both vessels. The DELOS was inspected and determined fit to proceed to shipyard for repairs.

Location: Atlantic Ocean, 186 miles off Shannon, Ireland
SummaryOfEvents: On 13 January 2010, at 2300 hrs, under heavy weather conditions, the fishing ship ORTEGAL UNO, took water, listed at port and sank in the Atlantic Ocean, 186 miles off Shannon, Ireland.  An initial distress call was received at 0900 hrs the same day.  All 17 crew members abandoned ship and were rescued by fishing boat ORTEGAL TRES and taken to La Coruna, Spain.  The naval patrol ship AOIFE attended to the scene.

Location: 85 kilometres NW of Fukue Island, Goto, Japan
SummaryOfEvents: On 12 January 2010, at 0430 hrs, the fishing boat, YAMADA MARU NO. 2, foundered approximately 85 kilometres NW of Fukue Island, Goto, Japan.  A distress call was received at 0350 hrs, earlier that same day.  Six crew members died and 4 were reported missing.  An emply liferaft was found in the area.  Six patrol boats and 2 helicopters effected SAR operations.  On 13 June 2010, the fishing boat was raised by a floating crane.  The body of one of the 4 missing crew members was found on the wreck.

On 11 January 2010, during a crossing from Ytad in Sweden to Ronne on the Island of Bornholm, the high-speed craft Villum Clausen hit one or more waves whilst travelling at a speed of 33-35 knots. The impact caused severe indentations in the bow.

The vessel immediately reduced her speed to 21-23 knots, and was able to continue her voyage to Ronne without further incident.

Six passengers and one crewmember were injured when the ship hit the waves. Upon arrival in Ronne, two of the six injured passengers had to be treated at the local hospital. The most severe injury was a broken hip.

On 11th January 2010 a crew member on board the container ship HYUNDAI GLOBAL was struck by a mooring rope which "jumped" from under a rope guide whilst unmooring in preparation to depart port. The crew member susequently died from the injuries he sustained. The guide was intended to assist "spooling" of the rope onto the drum, and not come under tension. Managers subsequently advised that the guides be removed.

At approximately 16.00 hours on 11 January 2010 the MONSUNEN was en route from Uddevalla, Sweden to Vejle, Denmark when she struck a rock, and the vessel immediately started to list to starboard. Shortly after, a ballast operation was initiated and the list was stabilized and subsequently the vessel restored to an upright position. The vessel then returned by its own power to Valhamn The vessel sustained major indentation on starboard side and penetration to a ballast tank. No polution or injuries to personel. The officer on watch was alone on the bridge at the time of the accident.

On 11 January 2010, under heavy weather conditions, the fishing boat REEFER III stranded after dragging its anchor at Colon, Panama.  All 3 crew members were rescued, with no injuries or pollution reported.  The boat has been laid up with minimum crew since 2007.  On 27 September 2010, the boat caught fire in the engine room during dismantling operations.  It was later sold for breaking up, which started with demolition in the same month 2010.

On Dec. 31, 2009 the MV Hui Ping sailed from Davant,U.S. to Hamburg, Germany. She was sailing on an easterly navigational course across the Atlantic on Jan. 10, 2010 when she encountered very bad weather. The low pressure system produced westerly winds of more than 40 knots and SW waves of more than 30 feet. The impact of waves over the poop deck combined with the movement of the ship eventually freed two cylinder liners stowed and secured on the poop deck.
 
While attempting to secure the loose liners, six seafarers were injured by the effect of the waves over the main deck. One of the seafarers lost consciousness in the incident and a decision to evacuate him was later made by the ship master. The vessel was about 460 miles off Newfoundland, Canada. The water that sprayed over the poop deck also made its way to the emergency generator room through the exhaust pipe of the emergency generator motor. The sudden activation of the emergency generator produced a short circuit in the emergency switch board.
In order to reach the location agreed upon with the Canadian SAR authorities for the evacuation of the injured crewmember, at 18:00LT of Jan.10, 2010, the vessel changed its course to head W, leading the vessel to receive the effect of the wind and the waves to be felt in the forecastle. The bos’n store was badly damaged accumulating approximately 1.5m of water. On Jan. 13 the injured crewmember was airlifted to Newfoundland, Canada. The vessel continued on her way to reach the port of refuge (Port Hawkesbury, NS, Canada) on Jan. 16, 2010.

On 10 January 2010, the cargo ship REENVI IV dragged anchor and was stranded on a beach south of Durres, Albania.  The ship was moved to a suitable area to be broken up by the local shipbreakers.  No injuries or pollution were reported.

SOLASStatus: DA XIN HUA YING KOU: Unknown/unspecified
SummaryOfEvents: On 1235 am 0f January 9th, 2010, the M/V "Da Xin Hua Ying kou" operated by the Shanghai Grand China International Ship Management Limited, collided with the fishing boat "Min Shi Yu 3785" owned by the individual, Meilin Village, Yongning Town of ShiShi City, Fujian Province during its voyage from The Port Of Quanzhou to The Port Of Qinhuangdao. The accident site located at 14 nautical miles southeast Nanri Island, Putian City of Fujian Province (Position Approximate   : 25 ° 03 '.53 N, 119 ° 46' .30 E). The fishing boat" Min Shi Yu 3785" sank in the accident, two of whose crew on the board were rescued while 1 crew dead and 11 crews missing.

Día 07 enero, a 06:55 horas la embarcación pesquera MARAYIRA, sufrio varadura en playa punta balcones, con tres (03) tripulantes a bordo, Patrón manifestó que durante faena de pesca en la mencionada zona fueron alcanzados por varias olas continuas de gran tamaño, todos los tripulantes lograron salir hacia la playa.

Location: A 21 MILLAS AL NORTE ISLA LOBOS DE TIERRA
SummaryOfEvents: Día 06 enero 2010 la embarcación pesquera INMACULADA, se quedó al garete por falta de combustible, siendo apoyado por embarcaciones que se encontraban en la zona, a 06:30 horas efectuó comunicación con el Patrón de la referida embarcación, manifestando que se encontraba navegando a 4 nudos con destino a Puerto Malabrigo a fin de efectuar la recarga de combustible.

At 0950hrs on 6 January 2010, the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) was informed that a passing Singapore-registered supply vessel had rescued 2 persons from a life raft about 16 nautical miles east of Horsburgh Lighthouse. The 2 persons rescued reported that they were from the Singapore-registered tugboat “Ocean Lark” and that their tugboat had capsized at about 0500hrs (Singapore time) on 6 January 2010.

After seven days of search efforts, MPA and Indonesia's Rescue Sub-Centre Tanjung Pinang terminated the SAR operation on 12 January 2010. Of the 13 persons reproted to be onboard "Ocean Lark" when the incident happened, two persons were rescued and 7 bodies were recovered in the course of the SAR operation.
Consequences1: Loss of life,Total loss of the ship

Location: At the DISCOVERY bay shipyard, Tsing Yi, Hong Kong
SummaryOfEvents:
The passenger ship "DISCOVERY BAY 6" caught fire whilst undergoing repairs at the DISCOVERY bay shipyard, Tsing Yi, Hong Kong at 1730 Hours on 05/01/2010. It was reported damage beyond economical repair. 
The blaze was extinguished with the assistance of local fire services by 1850 Hours on the same day. The ship sustained severe damages to accomodation and no injuries were reported.
In early 2010, the cargo ship, VAGERO sank while moored at Tartous, Syria.

SOLASStatus: CMA CGM VERLAINE: SOLAS, ODESSA STAR: SOLAS
SummaryOfEvents:
At 09:10 hours, on 4 April 2010, the Odessa Star, a container ship flying the flag of Malta collided with the CMA CGM Verlaine, a container ship flying the flag of Germany, in visibility of less than 1000m in the recommended Two-way route of the Bay of Izmit, Turkey. Each ship had a pilot on board. The Odessa Star had left her berth and the CMA CGM Verlaine was proceeding to this berth. As a result of the collision, the CMA CGM Verlaine sustained an 8x8 m hole on her port side amidships. 
The Odessa Star’s bow was damaged. The accident did not lead to any injuries and a small amount of pollutants escaped. Before the collision and on virtually reciprocal courses, one ship altered course to starboard, whilst the other altered her course to port, leading to a definite course.

On 2 January 2010 at 05.31 hrs (UTC +2 hrs) the  MT Pacific Empire went aground forward in Muuga Bay off  the eastern coast of Aegna Island in position of 59º35.3’N and 024º47.4’ E. Examination of ship’s spaces and tanks revealed that there was leak in the forepeak and in the tanks afore. The power plant and the rudder actuator were in order. The crew members were not injured and no pollution of the environment occurred. The ships, which were at anchor in the vicinity, were not damaged. The master of the ship informed Tallinn VTS operator and the agent about the accident.
The ship was refloated the same evening at 21.00 hrs after the ballast had been pumped out from the ballast tanks afore, using ship’s main engine  and being assisted by two tugs. Permission to proceed to an anchorage was asked from Tallinn VTS operator in order to have an additional examination of ship’s spaces and a diver survey carried out there. After the permission had been granted, the ship with a pilot aboard proceeded to the anchorage „L“. The ship was detained by PSC inspector of Estonian Maritime Administration. A diver survey was conducted on 03.01.2010 by the company Tuukritööde OÜ under surveillance of the representatives of Estonian Maritime Administration and the classification society ABS. The diver survey revealed the ballast tanks afore fractured and holed transversally. In addition, port side ballast tanks No 2, 3 and 4 were also examined inside in order to prove the existence of damages which had been discovered  during the diver survey. Periodical soundings of tanks revealed holes and a leak in the lower forepeak tank. The same applied to the port side ballast tank No 1 where the leakage was about 10 cm per hour. The tanker had significant damages of the hull but she did not pose danger to the environment. The ship was given permission for a single voyage to the repair yard to have the damaged plating replaced there in dry dock.
On 09.01.2010 at 10:00 hrs the MT Pacific Empire left the anchorage „L“ starting to proceed to Gdansk in Poland, the destination of the repair yard. The voyage passed without incidents and on 11.01.2010 in the morning the ship reached the roadstead of Port Gdansk.

On 1 October 2010 at 0300 hrs in heavy weather conditions, the cargo ship NAM YANG 8 developed list to port after cargo shifted in heavy seas 11 miles off Lacaylacy Point, Claveria, Philippines.  The ship sustained engine failure, drifted ashore and was stranded at Barangay Balaoi, Pagudpud, Philippines.  The hull was holed in several places  causing an oil leakage into the sea of 6,000 litres.  All 22 crew members abandoned ship to liferafts and reached the shore at Barangay Taggat, Claveria at 0630 hrs.  One crew member was injured and taken to hospital.  Demolition of the ship started in June 2010.

El día 01 de Enero del 2010, a las 11:00 hrs. LT aproximadamente, según declaración del Capitán, se le informo la existencia de una entrada de agua a la bodega Nº 2, el Jefe de Maquinas coloca una bomba de achique en la bodega Nº 2, al mismo tiempo se forma una brigada de emergencia para ubicar la vía de agua y realizar la evaluación de daños, la bodega se encuentra llena de pescado y carnada, a las 11:50 hrs LT aproximadamente el nivel de agua en la bodega Nº 2 estaba al menos al nivel de 1,5 mts por lo que se introdujo una bomba de achique sumergible, el capitán da la orden de tirar a la mar la carnada existente en la bodega y se continua la búsqueda de la via de agua, a las 21:40 LT aproximadamente suena la alarma de la sentina y se pone en funcionamiento la respectiva bomba de achique.

A las 21:55 después de una reunión con el primer oficial y el jefe de maquinas, al ver la imposibilidad de controlar la vía de agua y que por este motivo peligraba la vida de la tripulación, el Capitán da la orden que la tripulación acuda al punto de reunión con chalecos salvavidas, ropa adecuada y trajes de inmersión.

Siendo las 22:05 hrs. LT, el Capitán realiza la llamada de socorro por radio a los buques que se encuentran cercanos a ellos, y el siguiente buque respondió a la llamada de socorro:

•	B/P PLAYA MUIÑO VELLO

Siendo las 22:15 hrs. LT se lanzan por el costado de babor el bote de rescate y dos balsas salvavidas, el Capitan le da la orden al Primer Oficial que lleve al punto de reunión VHF portátiles, radio balizas, señales pirotécnicas y aros salvavidas, las balsas y el bote de rescate se arrean al costado de estribor, el Jefe de Maquinas cierra las válvulas de combustible.

Siendo las 22:40 LT el Capitan da la orden de abandono del buque y a las 00:10 LT llega el buque PLAYA MUIÑO VELLO acude al rescate, procediéndose el mismo sin ningún tipo de inconveniente y con toda la tripulación en perfecto estado.

Siendo las 01:20 hrs. LT el Capitán informo que estando toda la tripulación a bordo del PLAYA MUIÑO VELLO, se pudo observar el hundimiento completo del TOLIROVA, luego fueron trasladados al Puerto del Callao, Perú
